Title: Data Visualisation Analyst
Description:
Data Visualisation Analyst - Tableau, SQL, Python

Up to £65,000




I am working on a Data Visualisation role for a consultancy.




Requirements

To qualify for this Data Visualisation Analyst role, you will require:

· Strong experience with SQL and Python

· Strong stakeholder management experience

Salary

A successful candidate will receive:

· A Salary of up to £65,000

· Excellent progression opportunities

Please register your interest in this Data Visualisation role by applying via this website. For more information on this role or other roles in the Business Intelligence market, reach out to Kathryn Self at Harnham.

Title: Analyst- Investment Data
Description:
Our client is a market leading bulk annuity provider, they are expanding the team and looking for additional data science expertise. As the industry evolves they are looking to modernise and enhance their data capabilities. Role offers rapid progression and breadth of responsibilities.




Key Responsibilities:

Work closely with technology teams to deliver data solutions.
Collaborate with key stakeholders in the Investment business to investigate and resolve data issues.
Support and identify Data Owners, Stewards, and Custodians across an rapidly growing business.
Review and help enforce data policies and standards.
Lead Data Governance workshops and create reports and dashboards to track progress.




Requirements:

Proficiency in reporting and analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Excel, Power BI, DQ analysis).
Experience with EDM systems, data tools such as Azure or AWS.
Experience in Financial Services. Familiar with products like Fixed Income, financial instruments, swaps and Derivatives
Investment platform data analysis experience is a plus.




For more information on this role or any other similar roles we are working on please contact me at cynthia.chui@hfg.co.uk

Title: Investment Data Analyst
Description:
About the Role:

Our client, a leading insurance and asset management company based in London, is seeking an experienced Investment Data Analyst to join their Data Office team. This role focuses on enhancing investment data analysis, improving data quality, and supporting Data Governance initiatives.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Investment business stakeholders to investigate, analyse, and remediate data issues.
Lead and participate in Data Governance workshops, creating reports and dashboards to track progress.
Support Data Owners, Stewards, and Custodians in ensuring effective data management.
Review and update data policies and standards within the Data Governance framework.
Partner with technology teams to deliver solutions that align with business needs.




Requirements / Key Skills:

Experience as an Investment Data Analyst, preferably within financial services.
Proficiency in SQL, Data Management tools, MS Excel, Power BI, and Data Quality (DQ) analysis tools.
Knowledge of Fixed Income instruments, swaps, derivatives, and associated data.
Expertise in handling Market, Pricing, Custodial, and Positional data.
Familiarity with Data Governance practices and standards.
Ability to analyse large data sets, understand processes, and identify data issues.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Experience with modern investment data management technologies.
Background in insurance or asset management.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.




How to Apply:

If you’re a detail-oriented Investment Data Analyst looking for a challenging role, please apply with your CV and a cover letter highlighting your experience and interest.

Title: Fraud Data Analyst
Description:
MARTRUST: WHERE FINTECH MEETS MARITIME




MarTrust is a leader in digital payment solutions in the shipping industry.

With transformative products and a strong value proposition (including a “built for maritime” e-wallet and card), our transformative products have garnered tremendous market response and fuelled substantial growth.

Currently processing $12 billion in payments annually, we're just getting started!




MarTrust and the bigger picture

At MarTrust, we are dedicated to enhancing seafarer welfare.

With over a million seafarers worldwide working in challenging and sometimes perilous conditions, often far away from their loved ones, the process of paying them and facilitating fund transfers poses numerous complications and risks.

With the MarTrust E-Wallet, we comprehensively address these challenges, promoting increased seafarer welfare.

By providing peace of mind while they're away from home, we make a real difference in their lives, and that's truly meaningful to us.




THE ROLE: FRAUD DATA ANALYST




As a Fraud Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in detecting, analysing, and mitigating fraudulent activities across card and wire transactions. You will work closely with the Transaction Monitoring Manager and the broader Compliance team to ensure the integrity and security of our payment systems. Your role will involve leveraging data analytical skills, Python, SQL, and various analytical tools to identify suspicious activities, enhance fraud detection strategies, and support decision-making processes.




Your new day-to-day will involve:




• Fraud Detection and Analysis:

o Analyse transaction data to identify patterns and trends indicative of fraudulent activities.

o Investigate and monitor real-time transaction alerts to detect potential card fraud.

o Develop and implement data-driven fraud detection rules and models.

o Analyse false positives to refine and optimize fraud detection systems.

o Ensure that the company's financial practices comply with statutory regulations and legislation.

• Data Management and Analysis:

o Extract, clean, and manage large datasets using SQL and Python for in-depth analysis.

o Utilize data analytics tools to track, analyse, and report on key fraud metrics and KPIs.

o Create dashboards and reports that communicate actionable insights to stakeholders.

o Collaborate with IT and Data teams to improve data quality and accessibility.

• Model Development:

o Build and maintain predictive models using machine learning algorithms to identify fraudulent activities.

o Test, evaluate, and fine-tune models to improve fraud detection accuracy and reduce false positives.

o Document methodologies and results, ensuring they are well understood by both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

• Collaboration with Cross-Functional Teams:

o Work closely with the Product, Operations, Risk, and Compliance teams to respond quickly to emerging threats.

o Support the Transactions Monitoring Manager and Compliance Operations Manager in strategic fraud prevention initiatives and projects.

o Liaise with external partners, including banks, card issuers and processors, payment processors to gather intelligence on evolving fraud trends.

• Regulatory and Compliance Adherence:

o Ensure compliance with UK regulations, including GDPR, PCI DSS, and industry best practices related to card fraud prevention.

o Keep up to date with relevant legislation, ensuring that fraud detection activities are aligned with legal requirements.

• Continuous Improvement:

o Monitor the effectiveness of existing fraud detection measures and recommend improvements.

o Stay informed about the latest trends in fraud detection and payment technology.

o Participate in fraud prevention workshops, conferences, and training sessions to enhance skill sets.

This is what we need from you:




• Professional certifications in fraud detection, data analytics, or related fields are a plus.

• Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in a similar role, with a focus on fraud prevention and data analysis within Fintech or Banking.

• Technical Skills:

o Advanced SQL: Ability to write complex queries for extracting and analysing large datasets.

o Python: Proficient in using Python for data analysis, automation, and model development.

o Data Visualization Tools: Experience with tools like Metabase, Tableau, Power BI, or similar for creating insightful dashboards.

o Machine Learning: Familiarity with machine learning concepts and their application in fraud detection.

o Statistical Analysis: Strong foundation in statistics, including experience with hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and probability theory.

• Fraud and Risk Management Expertise:

o In-depth understanding of card fraud typologies and techniques, including phishing, card-not-present (CNP) fraud, and card-present fraud.

o Experience in building and analysing fraud detection rules, thresholds, and scoring systems.

o Awareness of financial industry standards and best practices for fraud detection.

• Analytical Mindset:

o Strong problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.

o Ability to interpret complex data and turn it into actionable insights.

o Familiarity with anomaly detection and pattern recognition techniques.

• Communication and Stakeholder Management:

o Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data findings into clear insights for non-technical stakeholders.

o Experience working within cross-functional teams, effectively managing relationships with internal and external partners.

o Strong report writing and presentation skills.

THE STRENGTH OF THE MARCURA BRAND BEHIND YOU

Marcura is led by the two visionary entrepreneurs who founded the company 22 years ago.

Their original mission, which we uphold today, is to streamline digital processes in the globally impacting shipping industry. We do this by putting our customers first.

As an established, successful, diverse and energetic company, we have developed a series of transformative products/brands specifically for the maritime industry which kill analog drag via digitalization.




Global and growing

Our 650+ customers are based in 53 countries.

Our 950+ strong team works in 25 countries.

We’re actively developing new products and new product features, and we are targeting continued and significant growth in 2024 and 2025!




You and Marcura

So far, we’ve done a pretty good job with significant growth and market leading products. But we’re even more ambitious now than ever. With big future growth plans we have vacancies for some new teammates with big talents and expertise. In short: We’ve got big plans.

To be passionate about our customers, we need to be passionate about hiring (and keeping) the best talent. That’s hopefully where you come in.

If you are talented and passionate about digital transformation, tech, platforms, SaaS, customer service, and excellence we’d be pleased to hear from you.







Marcura and diversity and inclusion

We’re 100% committed to preserving our culture of inclusion and diversity.

We’re all different. This makes us stronger as a company and helps to ensure we serve our diverse customers in the best possible way. We’re committed to hiring the best people for the jobs we have. And then making sure they’re happy and can prosper. We’ve made good progress already on gender diversity, a particular issue in the shipping industry. We welcome applications from people with disabilities, who may appreciate the flexibility of our remote excellence policy (work from home). So, if you see a job, you think fits your skills and experience, we’d love to hear from you.

SOME OF THE MARTRUST BENEFITS

When you join MarTrust, and the Marcura Group, you can look forward to a host of enticing benefits, including:




• Highly competitive salary and various other benefits

• An extensive and inclusive onboarding process, ensuring you hit the ground running and achieve success in no time.

• Flexibility to maintain a healthy work-life balance.

• Employment with a local team, while being part of a global and ambitious organization.

• A modern performance management framework designed to support your monthly growth and unleash your maximum potential.

• A vibrant working culture and the opportunity to collaborate with international players in the Banking, Payments, and Shipping industries.

Show more

Title: Commodities Data Analyst - Hedge Fund
Company: Paragon Alpha - Hedge Fund Talent Business
Description:
Paragon are representing a $23BN AUM mutli-strategy hedge fund, with global reach. After a strong performance in H1, they are building their commodities data business out to support recent PM hires in this space.




We have been mandated to find an elite Commodities Data Analyst to work in their commodities data integrations team, using Python, SQL, Pandas they will work with traders/engineers to deliver actionable insights curated from financial data sets.




We need 5 years+ experience in relevant seats, strong Python coding and experience with front office commodities data sets.




A strong academic STEM background is preferable.




Please apply if interested!

Title: Compliance Data Analyst
Description:
Compliance Data Analyst




Pareto Apprenticeships are a fast-growing provider of Sales, Digital and Management apprenticeships. As part of our ongoing growth, we are looking for a data analyst to join the Compliance team. Managing and analysing data is a vital part of the Compliance teams work to provide reliable data for our learners, employers and staff throughout their apprenticeship journey. You will join a dynamic team of dedicated staff to enhance a high-quality apprenticeship journey.

This role offers great long-term prospects for the right candidate, including participation in our company bonus scheme.




Role Description:

The Compliance Data Analyst role will become the main point of contact in the division for data queries, requests and development. The role will require an understanding of the ESFA funding rules to enable the person in the role to effectively analyse the data and report on any discrepancies or trends.




The data analyst will support the Head of Compliance & MIS to pull and distribute regular reports to other divisions and stakeholders within the business. The role will require the upkeep of existing reports but also the development of new reports and dashboards that will further enhance the experience of our staff, learners and employers.




Key Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

Create, update, develop and maintain a suite of internal reports and dashboards
Conduct detailed data analysis across a range of data sources
Provide data to Head of Compliance & MIS on a monthly basis on performance against team KPI’s
Create and manage weekly/monthly reporting and forecasts to the ASLT
Complete timely monthly submission of the ILR batch file to the ESFA in accordance with company policy and ILR Specification set by the ESFA
Ensure all funding errors on the ILR submission are cleared before final ILR upload each month
Run the monthly PDSAT report and work with wider team to fix any errors
Populate and share financial reporting and forecasts with ASLT and the finance team
Provide invoicing information to finance and log received payments in the ILR
Support with financial queries to and from finance and employers
Ensure the ILR is accurate and process any changes promptly (withdrawals, BIL’s, return from BIL etc.)
Regularly update and check the QAR data
Review FRM reports regularly and action as required
Analyse monthly ESFA payments compared to our expected income and report on any discrepancies
Support the Compliance and Sales teams to clear DLOCKs
Provide weekly reports to the functional skill and ALN teams
Pull and edit reports from the MIS
Adhoc data requests and cleansing
Adhoc Compliance support and audit




Development Opportunities:

Opportunity to complete a Level 4 Data Analyst apprenticeship
Opportunity to progress to MIS Manager as and when the role is available and skills requirements are met




The role offers a competitive salary as well as flexible benefits. We hope to be able to share our amazing office culture with you. We have an amazing virtual onboarding process that has been successfully implemented over the last few months and we will continue to provide you the best virtual start to your career of a lifetime with Randstad!




We are an inclusive employer and should you require any reasonable adjustments in order to complete any aspect of the recruitment process, please contact the Internal Talent Acquisition (ITA) team - Sunny.Dahri@randstad.co.uk | 07552001892

HTML:
Compliance Data Analyst


Pareto Apprenticeships are a fast-growing provider of Sales, Digital and Management apprenticeships. As part of our ongoing growth, we are looking for a data analyst to join the Compliance team. Managing and analysing data is a vital part of the Compliance teams work to provide reliable data for our learners, employers and staff throughout their apprenticeship journey. You will join a dynamic team of dedicated staff to enhance a high-quality apprenticeship journey.

This role offers great long-term prospects for the right candidate, including participation in our company bonus scheme.


Role Description:

The Compliance Data Analyst role will become the main point of contact in the division for data queries, requests and development. The role will require an understanding of the ESFA funding rules to enable the person in the role to effectively analyse the data and report on any discrepancies or trends.


The data analyst will support the Head of Compliance & MIS to pull and distribute regular reports to other divisions and stakeholders within the business. The role will require the upkeep of existing reports but also the development of new reports and dashboards that will further enhance the experience of our staff, learners and employers.


Key Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

  • Create, update, develop and maintain a suite of internal reports and dashboards
  • Conduct detailed data analysis across a range of data sources
  • Provide data to Head of Compliance & MIS on a monthly basis on performance against team KPI’s
  • Create and manage weekly/monthly reporting and forecasts to the ASLT
  • Complete timely monthly submission of the ILR batch file to the ESFA in accordance with company policy and ILR Specification set by the ESFA

  • Run the monthly PDSAT report and work with wider team to fix any errors
  • Populate and share financial reporting and forecasts with ASLT and the finance team
  • Provide invoicing information to finance and log received payments in the ILR

  • Review FRM reports regularly and action as required

  • Pull and edit reports from the MIS
  • Adhoc data requests and cleansing
  • Adhoc Compliance support and audit


Development Opportunities:

  • Opportunity to complete a Level 4 Data Analyst apprenticeship
  • Opportunity to progress to MIS Manager as and when the role is available and skills requirements are met


The role offers a competitive salary as well as flexible benefits. We hope to be able to share our amazing office culture with you. We have an amazing virtual onboarding process that has been successfully implemented over the last few months and we will continue to provide you the best virtual start to your career of a lifetime with Randstad!


We are an inclusive employer and should you require any reasonable adjustments in order to complete any aspect of the recruitment process, please contact the Internal Talent Acquisition (ITA) team - Sunny.Dahri@randstad.co.uk | 07552001892

Title: Senior Data insights analyst
Description:
Senior Data Insight Analyst

London

6 month contract




Core purpose of the role:

This is a great opportunity to join the Design Analytics & Measurement team. As a Senior Design Insight Analyst, you'll be responsible for embedding a data-driven approach to the design of change. Leveraging the Group’s wealth of customer data to apply advanced behavioural analytics skills to identify, inform and quantify the impact of design driven change.




What are we looking for?

We’re looking for an experienced data analyst/data scientist who will be responsible for the analytics agenda within a particular change domain. Someone who is able to support the design of customer centric change through the delivery of robust, high quality, actionable customer insights.

You’ll need to show a passion for the role data can play in driving evidence-based decision making, and an ability to translate data into practical analytics which creates impact and influences the direction of change. Someone who is able to work collaboratively with colleagues from across a number of fields, balance technical and business narratives, and effectively prioritise their own resources.




Essentials:

• Excellent understanding of SQL.

• A proven understanding of the Data Landscape.

• Strong analytical skills and knowledge of analytical techniques.

• A track record of translating data into compelling stories.

• Strong understanding of all aspects of financial services.

• A strong communicator with great influencing skills.

• The desire to make a difference!




Desirables:

• Experience of Data Visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI.

• A good knowledge of core analytical methods and statistical approaches.

• Experience of Python.

• Predictive modelling experience.




If you believe you have the experience required, please apply with your CV now for instant consideration!




TO APPLY - PLEASE APPLY WITH AN UP-TO-DATE CV

Candidates will ideally show evidence of the above in their CV in order to be considered.

Please be advised if you haven't heard from us within 48 hours then unfortunately your application has not been successful on this occasion, we may however keep your details on file for any suitable future vacancies and contact you accordingly.

*Pontoon is an employment consultancy. We put expertise, energy, and enthusiasm into improving everyone’s chance of being part of the workplace. We respect and appreciate people of all ethnicities, generations, religious beliefs, sexual orientations, gender identities, and more. We do this by showcasing their talents, skills, and unique experience in an inclusive environment that helps them thrive.

Title: Junior Digital Analyst/Graduate Digital Analyst
Description:
Junior Digital Analyst/Graduate Digital Analyst

Up to £35,000

Hybrid - London

A great opportunity to join a boutique digital agency as a Junior Digital Analyst

THE COMPANY

The business is a boutique digital agency offering a wide range of data and analytics services to clients across various sectors.

Joining the analytics team as Junior Analyst, you'll focus on analytics projects to help clients improve their digital performance. Whilst also getting opportunities to develop your skills and passion for data analysis and take the next step in your career.

THE ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Assist in creating insights reports and dashboards to visualise data insights
Conducting detailed analysis to identify trends, patterns and actionable insights
Collaborating with teams to understand data needs and provide analytical support
Maintaining and updating data management systems
Assist in implementation and monitoring of digital analytics tools and platforms for clients
Presenting and working directly with clients

YOUR KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Good experience in web analytics and dashboarding OR BSc in STEM degree subject from leading university (preferably an MSc in Analytics too)
All candidates will need some level of exposure to SQL and Python
Strong communication skills
Interest in digital/web analytics

THE BENEFITS

Up to £35,000
Hybrid
London

HOW TO APPLY

If interested in this role please send your CV

Title: Finance Data Analyst
Description:
Finance Data Analyst

London (Hybrid)

Up to £80k + Bonus

Permanent




HL1022




Finatal is currently partnered with a rapidly scaling e-commerce business who have recently had investment from a mid-market fund with a strong focus on data and analytics as a value-creation strategy. As they expand overseas, they are looking for their first finance data analyst to join the CFO and FP&A team to drive optimisation and revenue growth through data insights and recommendations. You will work closely with finance looking at revenue and profit margins but also cross-functionally with sales, marketing, pricing, and inventory ensuring you ask questions and challenge to give sound recommendations for the business.




Role:

Working closely with the Head of FP&A and CFO to report back on key insights, and trends from multiple business areas to increase the visibility of growth. This will involve collaborating with multiple executives from Sales, Marketing and Pricing functions etc.
Financial reporting on trading data, using Tableau, SQL, Excel, and relevant finance systems developing this reporting from the ground up.
You will analyse large and complex data sets, building visualisations to enable the board and investors to see the value of data, guiding them on decision making and bridging the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Opportunity to get involved in special projects including M&A, international expansion, and new finance systems.
In the Long term you will have the opportunity to build out a dedicated finance data team to ensure continuous improvement and efficiency.




Requirements:

You will be a curious self-starter with a passion for not just getting the numbers right but understanding ‘the why’ and the ‘so what’. You will be keen to leverage this into actionable insights to help drive business performance.
Experience working within an FP&A/ finance function using different finance modelling tools.
Strong SQL skills – including the ability to perform joins and subqueries.
Advanced BI skills (ideally in Tableau) with the ability to build and maintain complex dashboards.

Title: Business Analyst (Data). £50-60k
Description:
The Highlights!

We’re thrilled to be working with this impressive fintech business, based in Central London, focused on delivering insight products and services to the finance sector. After receiving significant investment, they are growing their data management function as they look to realise their ambition of building a market leading platform.

This data focused Business Analyst position is part of a growing delivery team that owns the development and improvement of core data workflows. Working in a matrix environment with talented teams in Data, Technology and Product, you’ll act as the connection point between end users and the data team, building an understanding of the as is and to be business processes.

A fantastic opportunity for someone to further develop their analysis skills, this role would suit someone moving from a data operations position or someone that has already established themselves as a Business/Data Analyst.

Our client’s working arrangements require three days per week in the office as a minimum. This is a deliberate and thoughtful choice that is aligned with an emphasis on collaboration between the product and data teams and the user community.

About The Company

This Fintech business has demonstrated an admirable track record of adapting to meet the needs of its customers, evolving its product portfolio and establishing itself as one of the leaders in the provision of insight products and services to the financial sector.

Through adopting a customer centric approach they have been able to demonstrate impressive growth domestically and internationally. It is the breadth of services, combined with investment in technology, and crucially the people that deliver it, that has seen the business go from strength to strength.

About The Opportunity

Working directly for the Head of Data, in a team that is set to grow significantly over coming months, your key focus will be on supporting the backlog of data management tasks undertaken by the Product Owners.

Using your eye for detail you’ll create accurate documentation that details the current state of core data systems, applications and workflows before working with Product Owners and stakeholders to document the target state.

You’ll use your inquisitive nature to ask questions of your users, helping you to understand the business needs that would drive new developments and enhancements to the core systems. Drafting requirements and preparing user stories, you’ll be building on the core skills that could ultimately support a move into product management.

An agile environment, this role will have you playing an active part in Scrum ceremonies, backlog refinement and preparation sessions. You’ll also use your data analysis skills to support decision making on what tasks to prioritise and why.

Bringing a quality focus to this position you’ll be involved in the testing process, from planning and executing User Acceptance Test scenarios and scripts as required.

Acting as the bridge between stakeholders and the engineering team, you’ll ensure that requirements are understood and met throughout the development process.

About You

A strong Data and Business Analyst, you’ll evidence the ability to blend core business analysis skills with an excellent grasp of data management and processing, using these skills to improve data workflows across the business.

In Addition, You’ll Demonstrate The Following


Experience working either in a data product business or in a data team that has been responsible for working with large scale data challenges. Time spent working in a Fintech environment is particularly helpful but not essential.
Ability to create data documents and artefacts.
Experience of working in an Agile environment and in partnership with Product Owners.
Strong data analysis skills using tools such as SQL and Power BI.
Exceptional communication skills that support your engagement with team members and stakeholders.
Confidence in visualising data and communicating your analysis of that data.


Inclusion Statement

We are dedicated to providing reasonable adjustments to applicants throughout the recruitment process and we work closely with our clients to encourage them to do the same.

If you require any accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, please let us know. Your needs will be treated confidentially and with respect.

We strive to eliminate biases and create an environment where all candidates are evaluated based on their skills, qualifications, and potential contributions.

If you have any feedback on how we can improve our process in any way, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Title: Alternative Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a global leading multi-manager multi-strategy hedge fund, is looking to add a Quantitative Analyst to the team of one of their top performng Portfolio Managers. The ideal candiate will have 3-4+ years of experience working directly with alternative data sets (assessing data sets, applying them and modelling them to predict underlying company KPI's).




Responsibilities:




Help management and scaling-up of a quantamental, mid-frequency, equities portfolio
Day-to-day oversight of the production processes
Research and development of new signals: including idea generation, data ingestion, research and trading
Build-out of the systematic trading infrastructure




Qualifications:




2-7 years as a Quantitative Researcher, Quantitative Developer, Data Analyst or Data Scientist
Experience with equities and equities data (alternative data, market data, fundamental data)
Experience with alternative data in the investment context, turning data into actionable insights
BSc / MSc / PhD in a technical discipline from a top university
Experience using Python in a production setting (expertise in Pandas, Numpy, Airflow…)




Nice to have:




Exposure to the fundamental investment process (e.g. Data Analyst working alongside fundamental PMs)
Specific sector expertise (in the context of alternative data)
Exposure to the systematic trading process
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS preferred) with working knowledge of multiple AWS services (S3, EC2, EKS, SQS, Redshift, IAM, ...)
Experience working in a Linux environment
DevOps tools: Airflow, Git, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes
Big Data tools: e.g. Databricks, Snowflake, Redshift
Research / trading for options (cash equities ideally)
Experience with web-scraping
Experience with execution, TCA and commercial risk-models
Open to candidates from the buy-side (HF experience is preferred)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

DATA ANALYST

Starting Salary Range - £31,312 - £32,307 (FTE £37,575 -£38,769)

Hours: Part time - 30 hours per week

Contract: Permanent

Based: Smugglers Way, Wandsworth, SW18 but opportunities for home working

About Us

Western Riverside Waste Authority is responsible for treating the waste and recycling collected by the London Boroughs of Hammersmith & Fulham, Lambeth, Wandsworth and the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea. The Authority is at a transitional stage, looking at how it may deliver waste services in the future, reduce carbon, prevent avoidable waste and provide value for money. We have some big decisions to make and we are developing strategies to help us make those decisions.

About The Role

The Data Analyst role has a dual function. As a Data Analyst, working within a small and highly focussed team, you will play an integral part in the delivery of our current contract monitoring role. You will also play a key role in developing analyses to underpin project decisions as part of our Strategies work.

What You Will Be Doing

You will be providing daily data reports and analyses of waste operational data to support monitoring of our current Waste Management contract and you will be supporting the development of a Joint Waste Strategy with our four Councils, and thinking ahead to the need for a procurement strategy for the replacement of the current waste contract in 2032. This will include:


the delivery of waste and recycling analysis and modelling projects using a range of analytical tools
undertaking data analysis and projections to support understanding of waste trends
undertaking data collection and analysis from publicly available sources
research and prepare data analysis reports that underpin and support decision-making around the continuation of existing projects and the implementation of new projects
undertaking environmental assessments to support options analyses and providing data on the environmental impacts and carbon emissions associated with the Authority’s services
drafting and presenting of reports to enable understanding of key trends and forecasts.
supporting colleagues in the Education Team to present data to inform and raise awareness of the need for waste prevention eg on the Authority’s website.


About You

You will need to have:


Practical experience of delivering waste and recycling modelling projects for or on behalf of local authorities or waste management contractors, including use of a range of tools and models
Good written English and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate technical information and results in an accessible format
Excellent data research, collection and analysis skills, including the ability to work with and manipulate large datasets
Excellent level of numeracy demonstrated both academically and practically
A methodical and rigorous approach with a high level of attention to detail and ability to produce work of a consistently high standard
Good organisational and planning skills with ability to prioritise workload and meet deadlines
An ability to develop positive effective working relationships with a range of people and
An ability to work on your own initiative as well as working as a member of a team


If you are a detail-oriented individual with excellent data research and analytical skills we would love to hear from you. Join our team as a Data Analyst and contribute to the successful delivery of our projects.

Benefits

In return, we can offer you a competitive salary, generous annual leave, membership of the Local Government Pension Scheme, an interest-free loan for a travel card and free and confidential support via our Employee Assistance Programme.

How To Apply

Please forward your CV with Covering Letter and equal opportunities form to recruitment@wrwa.gov.uk or post to:

Recruitment

Western Riverside Waste Authority

Smugglers Way

Wandsworth

LONDON SW18 1JS.

Please ensure you address ALL the items listed in the person specification in your covering letter to help us assess your suitability to be shortlisted for interview.

Closing Date: Wednesday, 25 th September 2024

Shortlisting Date: Tuesday, 1 st October2024

Interview Dates:Wednesday, 9 th October 2024

If you’d like to discuss this opportunity, please contact Trevor Pugh, Interim Deputy General Manager on trevor@wrwa.gov.uk

These dates are indicative only and could be subject to change.

Richmond and Wandsworth Councils

Attached documents


Job profile
Equal Opps form

You will be providing daily data reports and analyses of waste operational data to support monitoring of our current Waste Management contract and you will be supporting the development of a Joint Waste Strategy with our four Councils, and thinking ahead to the need for a procurement strategy for the replacement of the current waste contract in 2032. This will include:

  • the delivery of waste and recycling analysis and modelling projects using a range of analytical tools
  • undertaking data analysis and projections to support understanding of waste trends
  • undertaking data collection and analysis from publicly available sources
  • research and prepare data analysis reports that underpin and support decision-making around the continuation of existing projects and the implementation of new projects
  • undertaking environmental assessments to support options analyses and providing data on the environmental impacts and carbon emissions associated with the Authority’s services
  • drafting and presenting of reports to enable understanding of key trends and forecasts.
  • supporting colleagues in the Education Team to present data to inform and raise awareness of the need for waste prevention eg on the Authority’s website.

About You

You will need to have:

  • Practical experience of delivering waste and recycling modelling projects for or on behalf of local authorities or waste management contractors, including use of a range of tools and models
  • Good written English and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate technical information and results in an accessible format
  • Excellent data research, collection and analysis skills, including the ability to work with and manipulate large datasets
  • Excellent level of numeracy demonstrated both academically and practically
  • A methodical and rigorous approach with a high level of attention to detail and ability to produce work of a consistently high standard
  • Good organisational and planning skills with ability to prioritise workload and meet deadlines
  • An ability to develop positive effective working relationships with a range of people and
  • An ability to work on your own initiative as well as working as a member of a team

If you are a detail-oriented individual with excellent data research and analytical skills we would love to hear from you. Join our team as a Data Analyst and contribute to the successful delivery of our projects.

Benefits

In return, we can offer you a competitive salary, generous annual leave, membership of the Local Government Pension Scheme, an interest-free loan for a travel card and free and confidential support via our Employee Assistance Programme.

How To Apply

Please forward your CV with Covering Letter and equal opportunities form to recruitment@wrwa.gov.uk or post to:

Recruitment

Western Riverside Waste Authority

Smugglers Way

Wandsworth

LONDON SW18 1JS.

Please ensure you address ALL the items listed in the person specification in your covering letter to help us assess your suitability to be shortlisted for interview.

Closing Date: Wednesday, 25 th September 2024

Shortlisting Date: Tuesday, 1 st October2024

Interview Dates:Wednesday, 9 th October 2024

If you’d like to discuss this opportunity, please contact Trevor Pugh, Interim Deputy General Manager on trevor@wrwa.gov.uk

These dates are indicative only and could be subject to change.

Richmond and Wandsworth Councils

Attached documents

  • Job profile
  • Equal Opps form

Title: KYC/CLM Data Analyst
Description:
I have been mandated to support an international bank with identify a Data Analyst to join the client onboarding function. The role is full time and 3 days a week in the office based in the city.




Skills and Capabilities

Key skills required: Power BI, Excel VBA, Power apps, Sharepoint and M365.
Good understanding of KYC/AML requirements and the practical application in an onboarding and review environment.
Good understanding of Sanctions/Embargoes regimes and how they impact the bank.
Ability to articulate concisely and succinctly to ensure wider audience can be taken along the journey.
Deadline driven with a strong attention to detail.
An analytical mind to interpret JMLSG notes and incorporate them into banks KYC practices.
Proactive and problem-solving approach to look for compliant solutions.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Competencies - see requirements below.







Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities

Provide support and cover to the HoD.
Identify areas to increase efficiency and develop / maintain automation solutions to streamline Customer Onboarding’s processes.
Be the SME for client onboarding and KYC process implementations for department MI; tools and applications.
Use experience to anticipate future requirements and suggest improvements to existing business processes.
Perform UAT of processes and document Standard Operating Procedures (SOP).
Collaborate with stakeholders and engage with PMO to perform upgrades to core banking system (T24) for the purposes of customer level data to improve data integrity, and obtain stakeholder buy-in.
Meet stakeholder demands on complex client / departmental data analysis.
Support PMO and IT to identify, evaluate, and implement external services and tools to support data validation and cleansing.
Produce and maintain tracking of Customer Onboarding KPIs.
Develop and support cyclical Onboarding MI reporting, using business analytics reporting tools, to bank-wide governance forums with management oversight.
Gatekeeper of Onboarding internal data quality and support team on T24 customer-level data integrity.
Gather, understand, and document detailed bank-wide stakeholder requirements when introducing more efficient / automated solutions.
Create MI data dashboards, graphs, and visualizations to support Onboarding management and bank-wide stakeholders.
Develop and maintain working relationships and reporting lines with Risk department for the ongoing review and communication of Customer Onboarding’s risk profile.










Knowledge

Knowledge of banking and regulatory frameworks.

Knowledge of banking processes.

Knowledge of KYC and AML requirements for various customer types.

Knowledge of the Joint Money Laundering Steering Group (JMLSG) and the Money Laundering Regulations (MLR).




Experience

Experience working in a bank or a regulated financial institution is required.

Minimum 2+ years’ BA, Onboarding and Reviews experience.

Experience of working within Client Onboarding/Financial Crime with exposure to Money Laundering, Embargoes, Sanctions, High Risk Markets would be desirable.




IT Skills

Microsoft Office (Outlook/Word/Excel), Office 365/SharePoint, T24 banking system.

Title: Data Analyst – Media – 5 days on-site – London – 35k
Description:
Data Analyst – Media – 5 days on-site – London – 35k




My client is looking for someone to join their dynamic global media auditing consultancy, where they help clients optimise their media investments through data-driven insights and innovative solutions. They pride themselves on their commitment to excellence and their ability to drive significant value for their clients across the globe.




Responsibilities:

Analyse and interpret complex data sets related to media auditing.

Develop, maintain, and enhance reports and dashboards using Excel, Power Query, and Power BI.

Provide actionable insights to improve media investment strategies and outcomes.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand and address their data needs.

Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data used for reporting and analysis.

Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.




Requirements:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably within the media industry.

Advanced proficiency in Excel, Power Query, and Power BI.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Ability to work with large and complex data sets.

Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business).

Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.




If you are looking for a new challenge and want to join a team that is staffed by experienced, multinational, multilingual experts that care deeply about the success of their clients then I want to hear from you!

Title: Underwriting Data Analyst
Description:
We're Capital on Tap 👋

💳 Capital on Tap was founded with the mission to help small business owners and make their lives easier. Today, we provide an all-in-one business credit card & spend management platform that helps business owners save time and money. Capital on Tap proudly serves over 200,000 businesses across the world and our goal is to help 1 million small businesses by 2030.

Why Join Us?

We empower you to be innovative and solve complex problems. Take ownership, make an impact, and thrive in our scaling and agile environment.

🏡🏢This is a Hybrid role, the Credit Underwriting team work from our London (Shoreditch) Offices 3 days per week.

What You'll Be Doing

The Underwriting Data Analyst will play a key role assisting the Credit Underwriting team with shaping, creating and improving existing and new processes, monitoring and automation based on credit data and underwriting insights.

✨Helping to facilitate change in underwriting strategy to improve processes and efficiency

✨Monitoring the UK and US portfolios

✨Facilitating Risk initiatives and pilots by using credit data insights allowing for improved accuracy of decisions within company appetite

✨Manage and mentor the wider team to assist in their understanding of automations and new processes

✨Interacting with other internal teams to review all enquiries and provide credit insight and knowledge

✨Assisting in internal reviews and external audits

✨Staying up to date on industry trends and supporting new analytics initiatives that support and contribute to business goals

We're Looking For

The Underwriting Data Analyst will have knowledge of underwriting and data analytics to facilitate improvements in credit data usage, automation and monitoring within the underwriting team.

✨Experience in credit and data analytics

✨Ability to tell insightful and compelling stories with data

✨Driven and dedicated - willing to operate in a fast-moving environment, taking personal accountability for initiating and driving meaningful change

✨Smaller company/fintech and US market experience is a major plus

Diversity & Inclusion 🌈

We welcome, consider and encourage applications from anyone who shares our commitment to inclusivity. Join us in creating a space where authenticity thrives, and everyone can do their best work.

Great Work Deserves Great Perks

We try not to take ourselves too seriously (all the time) so we make sure our office is decked out with a pool table, arcade machine, beer tap, and a couple of office dogs thrown in for good measure. Check out our benefits:

🏥 Private Healthcare including dental and opticians services through Vitality

✈️ Worldwide travel insurance through Vitality

🎁 Anniversary Rewards (£250, £500, £750, 4-week fully paid sabbatical)

👛 Salary Sacrifice Pension Scheme up to 7% match

🏖️ 28 days holiday (plus bank holidays)

📖 Annual Learning and Wellbeing Budget

👪 Enhanced Parental Leave

🚲 Cycle to Work Scheme

🚂 Season Ticket Loan

💬 6 free therapy sessions per year

🐶 Dog Friendly Offices

🍫 Free drinks and snacks in our offices

Check out more of our benefits, values and mission here.



Other Useful Info

🤝Interview Process:

🤝First stage: 30 minute intro and values call with Talent Partner (Video call)

🤝Second stage: 30 minute CV overview with Team Manager (Video call)

🤝Final stage: 60 minute technical assessment with Senior Underwriting Manager (In person)

👍Check out our 'Top Tips' for interviewing.

✔️Keep updated on new job opportunities by following us on Linkedin.

📧Email careers@capitalontap.com if you have any questions.

Excited to work here? Apply!

If you'd like to progress your career within our fast growing, profitable fintech then click apply and we will aim to get back to you within 3 working days (during busy periods this could take up to 5 working days.)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - 9 months FTC

Full time

London - Hybrid







Who are Just?




We’re a FTSE 250 Financial Services company who specialise in retirement solutions and right now, our world is moving pretty quickly. With the defined benefit buy in / buy out space growing each year, Just continues to annually grow its business by over £4bn of assets.

We are a purpose driven company with compelling and credible goals. Quite simply, we help people achieve a better later life. We achieve this by providing competitive and innovative products, services, financial advice and guidance to help our customers achieve security, certainty and provide them with peace of mind in retirement.

That’s who we are. We’re a company on a mission: to become a beacon for the entire retirement industry. Because we believe everyone deserves a fair, secure, and fulfilling retirement.




Purpose




The primary purpose of the Data Analyst is to work collaboratively with business users to develop report, dashboards and other data that provide actionable insight for internal decision-making, support our regulatory reporting and deliver partner reports.

To enable this, the Data Analyst will work to specify, develop, deploy and maintain data/business intelligence products. The Data Analyst will also work to have a deep understanding of the source systems and business processes at Just as this will enable the production of high quality and valuable data products. Alongside this, the Data Analyst will work to elevate the data culture at Just by evangelising tooling, best practice and innovation using advanced analytics methods and tooling.




Job Role Accountabilities




Technical Subject Matter Experience– To be a subject matter expert regards to the data analytics subject area relating to data product design, data modelling, Purview and other technologies such as the Azure Data Platform. SME experience with SQL Server Solutions is a stretch.
Requirements Gathering – To work with business stakeholders to gather requirements which can be used for the purposes of data modelling and data product design and development.
Develop Bespoke Solutions - To develop high-quality bespoke data solutions using appropriate, industry-standard tools, technologies and languages aligned to the organizational target architecture and data strategy.
Technical Documentation - To ensure that high-quality documentation is developed, maintained, regularly reviewed and stored for all solutions developed and all operational processes.
Metadata Management – To work to collect metadata which can be added to relevant systems and solutions to improve usability.
Continuous improvement – Innovates by driving continuous improvement relating technical solutions, making appropriate use of new technology and recommending process improvements that will let the team to meet and exceed expectations.
Quality Assurance - To perform peer reviews of solutions and documentation in order to ensure that procedures and standards are followed consistently. Continuously work towards the objective of building in quality and provide appropriately tested solutions.
Operational Process Support - Support, execute and administrate weekly and monthly processes within the bespoke Financial Data Warehousing solutions.
Service Desk Requests - To act as second and third-line support in undertaking tasks assigned via Service Desk.
Stakeholder Engagement and Support – To engagement with stakeholders through various channels (e.g. surgeries, communities of practice) with a view data platform adoption and improve data maturity within the organisation.
Cross Platform Knowledge- To be able to support, develop and maintain the Azure Data Platform and the legacy SQL Server Data Platform (SQL Server platform is a stretch).




Examples of Key Activities




Business/process analysis based with support of business analysts.
Creation of requirements documentation based on business analysis which will be used to enable data modelling, data mapping to source and data product design
Creation of data product wireframes as part of requirements gathering process.
Definition of semantic models that enable report development and self-service reporting
Creation of measures and calculations within semantic models base don KPI definitions
Gathering metadata from the business to add to both purview and Power BI.
Participation in warehouse/data mart design collaborating with other team members.
Creating high quality data products which enable end users to consume insight easily.
Developing, testing and maintaining Power BI Reports, Paginated Reports and dashboards; PBRS/SSRS reports and Power BI Dashboards.
Development of SSAS cubes as required.
Evangelising the use of advanced analytics, best practice, and innovation using data tooling with the end users
Creating and maintaining the wiki and documentation for all development and analysis activities
Creating and maintaining documentation to enable end users to better use the services provided by the data team.
Supporting BAU operations as required on a rota basis which includes morning checks, managing the service desk queue and supporting out of hours testing as required.
Monitoring performance and usage of BI products and resolving any performance issues or outages in a timely manner
Providing support to business users through the Analytics Community or Practice framework including regular surgeries.
Carrying out ad hoc SQL queries for analysis and investigation
Engagement as Data SME on projects to provide expertise on data requirements and BI development timelines.
Supporting the business by flagging data quality issues and passing them to the Data Governance team for investigation and remediation.
Attendance of all SCRUM ceremonies (stand ups, retros, refinements, PIP Planning, etc).
Presenting to stakeholders as required.
Continuous Improvements of the data platforms at Just; Collaborating with the wider data department on innovative experiments.
Releasing developments and code into production environments.
Support and maintenance of Azure data solutions as required.




Skills and Experience




​Experience of supporting end users in the adoption and effective use of Data, Data Platforms and Data Products
Demonstrable skills in the Azure Data Platform namely Fabric, Power BI, Data Bricks, ADLS Gen 2 Storage
Experience with IT development processes and delivery lifecycles; development methodology; release strategy and configuration management; development tools, and applications across full project lifecycles.
Experience working within an Agile environment; delivering within defined Sprints; familiarity with Agile principles ceremonies.
Demonstrable experience with Microsoft, Azure and cloud applications and platforms.
Experience in the use of data catalogues and data quality technologies
Expert knowledge in the Power BI platform relating to support, administration and security
Demonstrable skills in Data warehousing, data lakes and big data solutions.
Proven skills relating to business analysis and requirements elicitation and documentation.
An aptitude for data development and the ability to understand and manage complex concepts
A willingness to learn new skills and adopt to new technologies.
Excellent data visualisation and presentation skills using commercial and/or open source software.
Creating credible KPIs and performance metrics.
Creating robust measures from operational data.
Operational familiarity in the use of meta-Data Management, data quality, and data stewardship tools and platforms.
Can quickly understand business problems and requirements and derive workable actions
Strong communication and relationship building skills .
Ability to constructively challenge requirements and current state to increase overall value to the organisation.
Flexibility to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity and rapid change




Qualifications

Bachelor/Master’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Information Management or equivalent experience in a Data Management/Business Intelligence profession
Azure Foundation Certs (AZ-900, DP-900)







Company Benefits

A Competitive Salary, Pension Scheme and Life Assurance
Along with 25 Days Annual Leave plus an Additional Day on us for your Birthday
Private Medical Cover and Income Protection, just in case
A generous and highly achievable bonus scheme – paid annually based on individual and company performance against targets
Opportunity to progress within your career both in-role and within the company
FREE access to the Headspace App, a 24/7 Employee Assistance Helpline and Trained Physical & Mental Health First Aiders (On-Site)
A variety of Employee Funded Benefits available to you via our Online Benefits Portal
Plus, several additional purchase options available for you and your loved ones




Why Just?




We are committed to building a more sustainable business and have publicly committed to reduce our scope 3 emissions to Net Zero by 2050 and our scope 1 and 2 emissions to Net Zero by 2025. We’ve made good progress so far and encourage our people to make small and meaningful changes in their everyday lives, so that we can protect our planet for future generations.




Diversity, Equity and inclusion (DE&I) is a key priority for Just as part of our overall strategy and ensuring all of our people feel proud to work at Just. We have joined a number of initiatives including the Race at Work Charter, designed to improve outcomes for employees from underrepresented backgrounds. We also run a Reciprocal Mentoring scheme for employees from a BAME background, those with a disability and those who identify as LGBTQ+. There are multiple employee network groups, which champion issues including race, gender, social mobility and neurodiversity.




What’s clear about working at Just is that we care. We care about our customers, our purpose, our environment, inclusivity, wellbeing and most importantly - each other.




Show more

  • Demonstrable skills in the Azure Data Platform namely Fabric, Power BI, Data Bricks, ADLS Gen 2 Storage
  • Experience with IT development processes and delivery lifecycles; development methodology; release strategy and configuration management; development tools, and applications across full project lifecycles.
  • Experience working within an Agile environment; delivering within defined Sprints; familiarity with Agile principles ceremonies.
  • Demonstrable experience with Microsoft, Azure and cloud applications and platforms.
  • Experience in the use of data catalogues and data quality technologies
  • Expert knowledge in the Power BI platform relating to support, administration and security
  • Demonstrable skills in Data warehousing, data lakes and big data solutions.
  • Proven skills relating to business analysis and requirements elicitation and documentation.
  • An aptitude for data development and the ability to understand and manage complex concepts
  • A willingness to learn new skills and adopt to new technologies.
  • Excellent data visualisation and presentation skills using commercial and/or open source software.
  • Creating credible KPIs and performance metrics.
  • Creating robust measures from operational data.
  • Operational familiarity in the use of meta-Data Management, data quality, and data stewardship tools and platforms.
  • Can quickly understand business problems and requirements and derive workable actions
  • Strong communication and relationship building skills .
  • Ability to constructively challenge requirements and current state to increase overall value to the organisation.
  • Flexibility to adjust to multiple demands, shifting priorities, ambiguity and rapid change


Qualifications

  • Bachelor/Master’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Information Management or equivalent experience in a Data Management/Business Intelligence profession
  • Azure Foundation Certs (AZ-900, DP-900)



Company Benefits

  • A Competitive Salary, Pension Scheme and Life Assurance
  • Along with 25 Days Annual Leave plus an Additional Day on us for your Birthday
  • Private Medical Cover and Income Protection, just in case
  • A generous and highly achievable bonus scheme – paid annually based on individual and company performance against targets
  • Opportunity to progress within your career both in-role and within the company
  • FREE access to the Headspace App, a 24/7 Employee Assistance Helpline and Trained Physical & Mental Health First Aiders (On-Site)
  • A variety of Employee Funded Benefits available to you via our Online Benefits Portal
  • Plus, several additional purchase options available for you and your loved ones


Why Just?


We are committed to building a more sustainable business and have publicly committed to reduce our scope 3 emissions to Net Zero by 2050 and our scope 1 and 2 emissions to Net Zero by 2025. We’ve made good progress so far and encourage our people to make small and meaningful changes in their everyday lives, so that we can protect our planet for future generations.


Diversity, Equity and inclusion (DE&I) is a key priority for Just as part of our overall strategy and ensuring all of our people feel proud to work at Just. We have joined a number of initiatives including the Race at Work Charter, designed to improve outcomes for employees from underrepresented backgrounds. We also run a Reciprocal Mentoring scheme for employees from a BAME background, those with a disability and those who identify as LGBTQ+. There are multiple employee network groups, which champion issues including race, gender, social mobility and neurodiversity.


What’s clear about working at Just is that we care. We care about our customers, our purpose, our environment, inclusivity, wellbeing and most importantly - each other.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst

Up to £65,000

Hybrid - London

A great opportunity to join a leading financial tech company as a Senior Data Analyst

THE COMPANY

The business is a leading financial tech company specialised in credit scoring, reporting and offering various credit focused products. Currently the business is undergoing a rapid data and product transformation and have a range of new exciting projects coming up, hence they are looking to hire a Senior Data Analyst into the team.

Joining the business as a Senior Data Analyst, you'll be supporting the Analytics team with a range of analytical projects focused on new product innovation.

THE ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Building out new monitoring and reporting dashboards
Helping the business across acquisition and retention to understand the benefit of marketing activity
Analyse A/B tests and experiments to enable improvements to campaigns and user experience
Deliver substantial analytics projects, using data to identify opportunities to analyse and solve complex business problems
Carrying out analysis to launch new products and improve existing projects

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Strong SQL and Data Visualisation experience
Background in Marketing/Customer Analytics or Insight
Proven track record working with senior stakeholders

THE BENEFITS

Up to £65,000 + benefits
Hybrid
London

HOW TO APPLY

If interested in this role please send your CV to Jordan Victor via the Apply Link below

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Title

Business Intelligence Analyst

Job Description Summary

Job Description

Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst

Job Type: Full-time

Location: UK

Job Description:

As a Business Intelligence Analyst for our UK business, you will be a pivotal member of the UK dedicated BI team, focused on local delivery and transforming UK’s analytics offerings. Collaborating closely with local teams and leadership, you will leverage data to drive insights, enhance client value, and propel our business operations forward. Working in tandem with a locally focused data operations team, your role is nested within the larger EMEA Analytics team, ensuring synergy with a wide array of talent including data scientists and automation specialists. You will specialise in analysing and interpreting data, providing actionable insights to inform strategic decisions for both our clients & internal operations. Your exceptional analytical skills, combined with a deep understanding of BI tools, will enable you to visualise and communicate complex data effectively. This high-visibility role is not just about analysing numbers, it's about being at the heart of innovation and playing a key role in driving significant, positive change across our organisation.

Responsibilities:


Collaborate with clients and internal stakeholders to deliver market, client, and operational intelligence.
Serve as the client's advocate, translating their needs and feedback into actionable insights.
Simplify and present complex data clearly to diverse audiences, ensuring understanding across all client types and levels of leadership.
Convert strategic business inquiries into actionable insights by actively seeking out and defining necessary analytics resources and requirements.
Create prototype solutions such as reports and dashboards to visually represent complex data sets and support insight generation.
Partner closely with wider EMEA Analytics Team to ensure the maximum value and best outcome is achieved.
Deliver on the KPIs assigned to you that align with business goals, supported by a solid analytical framework.
Facilitate communication between business units and Analytics teams to clearly define project objectives, business needs, and timelines, enhancing data organization, innovation, and optimization.


Requirements:


English is a requirement.
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Real Estate or Technology.
Common MS Office applications to excellent levels including SharePoint and OneDrive.
Min. 2 years of experience in Power BI preferable (or any other data visualization tool e.g. Tableau)
Python and SQL skills advantageous
Great attention to detail, diligent and focused.
Committed, able to work to deadlines, prioritise and juggle between tasks.
Business writing and reporting skills
Thoughtful, collaborative, and proactive ready to engage with stakeholders across the globe.
Ability to build & maintain effective working relationships with internal and external personnel.
Demonstrate flexibility and ability to deliver.
Good team player, also able to work independently.
Curiosity and drive to solve problems.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe’s most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements


2-8+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Strong statistical knowledge
Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.



Preferred Qualifications


Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.



Hybrid work at Stripe

This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office).

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual salary range for this role in the primary location is C$128,700 - C$174,100. This range may change if you are hired in another location. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings (“OTE”) range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and specific location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the primary location may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Specific benefits and details about what compensation is included in the salary range listed above will vary depending on the applicant’s location and can be discussed in more detail during the interview process. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; retirement plans; health benefits; and wellness stipends.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Astek Group




Founded in France in 1988, Astek is a global player in engineering and technology consulting. With its expertise in various industrial and tertiary sectors, Astek supports its international clients in the intelligent deployment of their products and services, as well as in the implementation of their digital transformation.




Since its inception, the Group has based its development on a strong culture of entrepreneurship and innovation, and on the support and upskilling of its 7800 employees who are committed every day to promoting the complementarity between digital technologies and complex system engineering.




In Canada, the firm specializes in IT consulting services and engineering. Our teams successfully drive our clients' development strategies. Around common values, we have gained their trust and address their business challenges by putting their needs at the center of our actions and priorities.




This ecosystem of expertise enables Astek Canada to adapt quickly to evolving technologies, and all employees participate collaboratively in their development.




Are you ready to take on a new challenge, give your career a boost, and participate in innovative and stimulating projects?




Join a rapidly growing Group in Canada and worldwide that achieved a turnover of €600 million in 2023.










Your mission would be:




• Work with SMEs to automate daily PnL processes related to FX Options and Global Metals business.

• Build end to end reconciliations as directed by SMEs within the team – Book of Record to PnL Reporting Tool to General Ledger.

• Data profiling to prove out and challenge detailed requirements – identifying outliers or missed requirements.

• Build visualizations in Power BI for Senior Executives.

• Attend daily project meetings.







Your profile:




• Automation ( Small technology ) experience = 2 years.

• Power BI / Python / Alteryx / UiPath knowledge = 2 years.

• Capital Markets experience = 1-2 years.

• Accounting experience (a plus).







Let's meet!

Do you like our common project?

Apply here and join our team!







Our Advantages

• A tailored CARE policy deployed by our HR teams for our employees.

• Our Diversity Charter.

• Activities among colleagues such as Teambuilding or Happy Hours.
