Come work with us to do what you love and stay for the Frontier TRACK …

  • Team Centric: We each take responsibility for fostering an environment of personal and professional growth. We are eager to help, support and collaborate with one another recognizing that we are better when we work together.
  • Respectful and Inclusive: We treat everyone the way we want to be treated and accept everyone on the team just as they are.
  • Autonomous and Accountable: We are entrusted with and given the space to do our work and in turn hold ourselves accountable for results.
  • Committed to Excellence: We are fueled by the desire to be our best and to make an impact now and tomorrow.
  • Keep it Real: We lead with integrity and genuineness in our work, interactions and relationships.


We are seeking a talented and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our team. This role This is a newly created role which will report into our Chief Marketing Officer. The incumbent will play a pivotal part in the growth of our organization by leading all marketing analytics and data-driven strategies. The Marketing Data Analyst will be responsible for providing actionable insights and automating processes to support our marketing efforts, drive customer acquisition, and enhance our promotional strategies.


The key responsibilities and how you will make an impact:


  • Lead Marketing Analytics: Take ownership of the marketing scorecard, analyzing channel performance, customer behaviour, and promotional effectiveness to guide strategic decisions.
  • Customer Insights: Utilize data to understand customer lifetime value (CLV), purchase frequency, and average order value. Set up automated segmentation utilizing statistical modeling to target marketing efforts more effectively.
  • Product Performance: Analyze sales data to identify cross-sell and upsell opportunities, optimize promotion strategies, and monitor product performance across different channels and customer segments.
  • Automation and Reporting: Develop and implement automated reports and processes using Power BI, Python, and SQL to streamline marketing operations and improve team efficiency.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including Sales, Purchasing, IT, and Finance, to drive data-informed decisions and support promotional campaigns.
  • Data Visualization: Create detailed reports and data visualizations to present key findings to stakeholders, including senior leadership, aiding in understanding financial performance and recommending improvements.


You are our ideal candidate if you have:

  • A post-secondary degree in marketing, business analytics, data science, or a related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Proven experience in marketing data analysis, preferably in e-commerce, retail, or consumer goods industries.
  • Strong understanding of Google Analytics 4 (GA4) for analyzing and interpreting marketing data to drive actionable insights (cost, impressions, clicks, revenue, conversions, ROAS, etc.).
  • Expertise in data tools such as Python, Excel, and SQL, with a strong ability to build process automation.
  • Skilled in using analytics tools such as Looker Studio, PowerBI, Big Query, and Google Cloud Platform.
  • A deep understanding of marketing metrics, customer behaviour analysis, and promotional strategies.
  • Familiarity with CRM and ERP systems for extracting and analyzing data.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable insights.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with experience presenting data to senior leadership.
  • Self-motivation and a strong desire to execute and achieve results in a fast-paced environment.


Why join us? (Brace yourself…)


  • We offer competitive compensation
  • Extended Health and Dental Benefits Plan (100% Employer-paid Premiums)
  • Real career growth opportunities
  • Flexibility to help you balance work and life
  • Supportive leadership team and Culture Committee that works to maintain a positive culture
  • Collaborative, non-competitive work environment
  • Fully stocked snacks, team BBQs, and other company-paid meals (we love to eat!)
  • Oh, and you will often see dogs in the office.


What are we at the frontier of?


Providing quality and top brand dental supplies to dental practices all across North America. Our customers trust our deep knowledge of the dental trade and our ability to provide the right products at competitive prices, all through simple and efficient channels. We currently sell and distribute more than 30,000 unique products to 2,000 dental offices in Canada and the U.S. We’re on the cusp of something big.


With roots in the dental wholesale and distribution industry Frontier Dental Supply, Inc., was formed in 2016. We are headquartered in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA).


We are proud to have been certified and awarded the following:

  • Great Place to Work for three consecutive years.
  • The Best Workplaces in 2021.
  • Finalist for Fastest Growing Company 2021 and Startup Business of the Year 2021 by CanadianSME.
  • Excellence in Customer Service 2023.


Who is at the frontier of our success?

Our people. Our people make it all possible. That's why we seek to grow our team with individuals who desire to stay on course the Frontier TRACK.


Learn more about what it’s like to work at Frontier Dental Supply Inc. from our very own employees on our Glassdoor page.


We’re rooting for you! We thank all candidates for taking the time to apply. However, only those candidates selected to move forward in our recruitment process will be contacted.


Here at Frontier Dental, we are a diverse team that nurtures an inclusive environment. We attribute our growth significantly to our ability to learn from one another’s perspectives. Frontier Dental values the unique skills and experiences of each of our candidates; recognizing that each prospective team member contributes to our efforts in building a diverse and inclusive place to work. We are committed to being an equal opportunity employer and are happy to provide accommodations upon request at all stages of the recruitment process. Should you require any disability-related accommodation to support your participation in our recruitment process, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.


The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of employees so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Electronic Arts is looking for students to join our world-class internship experience. Summer 2025 will be better than ever as we bring all interns together on-site for orientation week and prep students for the future ways of work by offering remote and hybrid opportunities depending on your location. For more information about our Next-Gen Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates

Our teams build meaningful relationships with hundreds of millions of players around the world who love our games. We aim to be the best at meeting players where they are and supporting them throughout their journey with EA. Our teams develop the strategic vision of our products, run outstanding multi-channel campaigns, build global engagement across all touch points, develop global insights, and propel sales and global publishing. We understand the dynamic global landscape so we can bring relevant content, promotions, and help to players anywhere.

What You’ll Do


You will perform data analysis on a business process to provide an objective view of the business's operations.
You will evaluate metrics that provide feedback on the efficacy of the business.
You will prepare detailed reports and presentations that help the internal partner identify important areas of opportunity and insight to guide future design.
You will develop statistical analysis models for hypothesis testing, prediction, or inference.


Qualifications


You are currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s Degree granting program in a related field
You understand how data is stored in databases and can write SQL code to retrieve it.
You can visualize high readability data insights using software tools like Power BI, Tableau, Looker, or similar BI tools.
You can write functional Python or R code to answer data analysis questions.
You can apply statistical analysis solutions using Python or R language.


You must be available for a full-time paid internship in the Summer of 2025.

We are only considering students who will be enrolled in an accredited degree program in the Summer of 2025, slated to graduate no earlier than December 2025. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in Canada on a full-time basis during the 16-Week Internship. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

Bc Compensation And Benefits

The base salary ranges listed below are for the defined geographic market pay zones in these states. If you reside outside of these locations, a recruiter will advise on the base salary range and benefits for your specific location.

EA has listed the hourly pay ranges it in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in the locations listed, as of the time of this posting. Salary offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, degree type (e.g. Bachelor’s, Master’s, PhD), what stage you are in your degree journey (i.e. freshman, sophomore, etc.), qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, and business or organizational needs.

HOURLY PAY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria):


º $29 - $31

The hourly pay is just one part of the overall compensation at EA. We also offer a package of benefits including 80 hours per year of sick time (prorated based on scheduled hours per week if less than full-time), 16 paid company holidays per year, medical insurance, and 401(k).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our Data Analyst is primarily responsible for creating and maintaining effective reports in Power BI, Excel, and other reporting tools, as deemed necessary. Additionally, the role involves assisting with the maintenance and enhancement of data warehouse objects in Microsoft Azure.




This person will bring a sharp analytical mind, inclination for problem solving, and strong communication skills to provide meaningful insights that can translate into evidence-based business decisions.




Responsibilities:

Prepares reports in Power BI, Power BI Report Builder and other platforms
Conducts research and meets with internal stakeholders to thoroughly understand business problems and reporting deliverables
Thinks critically to offer effective solutions/improvements to data collection and report generation processes
Creates presentations showcasing reporting insights and actionable strategies
Builds and maintains ETL/ELT pipelines for efficient data processing and integration
Assists with the development of data warehouse objects in SQL/ Microsoft Azure, ensuring efficient data storage and retrieval
Thinks critically to offer effective solutions to data collection and report generation processes
Monitors the performance of reports, implements improvements as required, and ensures data integrity
Performs other duties as required to meet organizational requirements

Requirements:

Proficiency with SQL, Power BI (DAX, Power Query, and Report Builder), and Excel
Experience with data warehousing, creating/ using data models, and managing databases
Highly analytical mindset with the ability to prepare reports including descriptive statistics
Ability to communicate technical requirements and reporting insights effectively
Knowledge of ETL/ELT processes and tools, with hands-on experience in building pipelines
Proficiency or practical experience with big data solutions for data processing and analysis
Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to offer innovative solutions
Excellent prioritization and time management skills; exceptional attention to detail
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently with limited direction

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
THE TEAM

The mission of the Data & Analytics Department is to provide the business with actionable and accurate information to enable data-driven decision-making.




THE OPPORTUNITY

Aritzia is growing and our Data & Analytics team is growing with it. This is a unique opportunity to be part of the team responsible for bridging the gap between business strategy and data. As a Sr. Data Analyst, you will combine your deep understanding of who our clients are with your passion for data and masterful analytics skills to uncover opportunities that will enable Aritzia to create long lasting relationships with clients. With the skills you gain in this role, the opportunities are endless – from a rewarding career in Analytics to continued growth and development with Aritzia.

*Please note this role could also be based out of New Westminster.




THE ROLE

As the Sr. Data Analyst, you will:

Partner closely with business leaders and cross-functional partners to enable data-driven decisions that will enable efficiencies, enhance customer experience and grow the business
Consider where we can adopt advanced analytical approaches and influence deployed models through feature engineering and modeling
Work independently to deliver on requirements with the highest quality, as well as collaboratively to raise the acumen across data & analytics
Clearly visualize and communicate data through reports, dashboards, and presentations
Identify and refine modeling requirements to enable insight creation that clearly communicate outcomes and value to stakeholders
Understand and transform complex business problems into data & analytics requirements
Leverage advanced analytics to derive data driven insights, predict outcomes and recommend actions




THE QUALIFICATIONS

The Sr. Data Analyst has:

Proven skills, certifications, education, and/or experience:
SQL
Visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI)
Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
Python, R or other related analysis tools
Familiarity working with AI/ML models
Experience working in Retail, eCommerce, or Customer driven industries would be an added benefit
A commitment to learn and apply Aritzia's Values and Business and People Leadership principles




THE COMPENSATION

The typical hiring range for this position is $75,000 - 125,000 CAD per year. The final agreed upon salary may vary based on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills and experience. Additionally, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity.




We are always looking for top talent - if your qualifications differ from those listed above, the scope of work and final agreed upon [salary/wage] may be adjusted to reflect your individual qualifications.




Aritzia’s Everyday Luxury compensation package goes beyond the base salary with endless growth and recognition opportunities through our pay-for-performance philosophy. Along with comprehensive benefits, aspirational workspaces and elevated employee perks and experiences - we provide it all.




THE PERKS

Some of the industry-leading benefits you will receive working at Aritzia:

Product Discount – Maybe you’ve heard of our famous product discount? Or our exclusive private shopping events? You have now.
A-OK Commissary & Café – Everyday Luxury dining, exclusive to Aritzia. Our in-house bistro and café is a private oasis where employees can enjoy curated, subsidized Everyday Luxury dining.
The SET – Our in-office fitness studio and gym with state-of-the-art equipment, custom-created classes, and optional personal training. Open 7 days a week, works out well.
Aritzia Virtual Wellness – Because your health, happiness, and safety matter – 24/7 resources to support you in your wellbeing goals, be it physical, mental, social, or financial.
Aspirational Workplace – Our offices are specially designed to be spaces of creativity, productivity, and inspiration. They’re also dog friendly. Woof.
Amenities – Additional amenities include a private parent’s room, shower facilities with elevated complementary conveniences, bike rooms, and more.
The Extras – We also offer a multitude of other perks like dry-cleaning, hotel and restaurant discounts, self-care promos and on-site medical care.










ARITZIA




Aritzia is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Our goal is to be inclusive, diverse, and representative of the communities where we work while creating an environment where every person can enjoy a successful career. This commitment applies to all candidates and employees regardless of race, ethnicity, citizenship, creed, place of origin, religion, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, family status, marital status, disability, age, and any other protected characteristic.




Requests for accommodation due to a disability or any other protected characteristic can be made at any stage of the recruitment process and during employment by contacting our People & Culture Team.

Title: Data Analyst, Investment Data Management
Description:
Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group (CCLFG)

Vancouver, BC

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Vancouver based Investment Data Management team.

The Investment Data Management Team (IDM) resides within the middle office and is responsible for managing data centric processes and data quality that supports the investment management business. Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group Ltd. (CCLFG) manages a wide range of global assets and heavily relies on the output of the DMT for a variety of functions from the front office to the back. This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of a dynamic strategic team whose scope and importance continues to grow enterprise wide.

We place a high value on maintaining an entrepreneurial spirit and creating a culture where each of us have opportunities to succeed. We are a solution orientated and collaborative team seeking likeminded individuals who thrive in a challenging and dynamic environment. This is a Vancouver based role, which offers a flexibility between working from home and the office.

What You’ll Be Doing

This role operates in a unique position, working closely with front office traders, investment managers and a wide range of investment-operation business unit in the middle and back-office. You will use your financial and technical knowledge, to provide critical investment data inputs to the whole investment operations process. Our analysts are empowered to thrive as process owners, with both the creativity and responsibility that comes with delegation. Our

team continuously strives to identify improvements to operations to scale and grow with the business; you will work highly collaboratively with your team members and dedicated development teams to execute.

Key Responsibilities Include


Security Master: Maintain and validate accuracy of equity/fixed income/derivative data across multiple systems/databases to enable Investment Manager modeling, trading, and risk monitoring.
Process Manager: Manage and enable a myriad of scheduled processes for vendor systems, internal and market data transfers, valuation, and benchmarking data inputs to the investment process.
Data Quality Expert: Deliver timely data signoffs to investment teams; develop and analyze data-quality exceptions and ensure timely resolution.
Stakeholder Servicer: Provide analysis on operational needs, ad-hoc data/data-history requests for multiple business partners to support pre- and post-trade portfolio management functions.
Process Improver: Identify process/workflow improvements to increase operational efficiency, mitigate risk, improve data-quality, and increase service levels provided to stakeholders.
Supporter of other operational or engineering staff, senior or managers on a variety of ad-hoc tasks and projects.


About You


Education – You have a degree in Finance, Commerce, Business Administration, Business Operations, or a related field. Relevant designation, such as the MBA, CFA, or FRM is an asset.
Industry Knowledge – Some experience in the investment management industry with exposure to equity, fixed income, and/or derivatives would be ideal. 1-2 years would be an asset.
Problem Solver / Technical – You possess an analytical mindset and able to break down complex processes into components to logically deduce the root cause of issues in data and technology.
Collaborative – You have a collaborative spirit that helps you to work well with others and you communicate effectively to team/cross-team members, and upward to key stakeholders.
Self-Motivated – You have a passion for advancing the quality, scale, and efficiency of data processes and can take ownership of multiple processes with keen attention to detail.
Continuous Process Improvement Mindset – You constantly take a critical eye to processes with the goal of finding improvement opportunities and bring an ability to manage multiple projects.


The salary range for this position is 60-90k. The salary range provided reflects the base salary range for this position as required by legislation. In addition, there is an annual performance bonus which contributes to the total compensation of this position. Further questions may be directed to the HR team during the interview process.

About Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group

At Connor, Clark & Lunn Financial Group, we understand the value of opportunity – for our clients and our team. Independent and employee-owned, we partner with investment professionals to grow successful asset management businesses, giving them the space to innovate and truly make an impact.

With more than 40 years of history and offices across Canada and in the US, the UK and India, CC&L Financial Group and our multi-boutique family of affiliate firms collectively manage over $133 billion in assets, providing a diverse range of traditional and alternative investment products and solutions to institutional, high-net-worth and retail clients.

For a closer look at how you can build your career with us, we invite you to explore www.cclgroup.com .

CC&L is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation or expression, disability, or age.

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter as one PDF.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, but only those candidates shortlisted for interviews will be contacted. No telephone calls or recruitment agencies will be accepted.

Apply for this Position


Show more

CC&L is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation or expression, disability, or age.

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and cover letter as one PDF.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, but only those candidates shortlisted for interviews will be contacted. No telephone calls or recruitment agencies will be accepted.

Apply for this Position

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
HTML:
Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice.

Summary:

We are currently looking for a new Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Business Intelligence team in one of our Vancouver, Calgary, or Toronto locations.

What your team does:

Our Business Intelligence team is part of the larger Data & AI group. Together, we’re focused on stewarding a scientific culture to drive better decisions. Along with the Manager of Business Intelligence, you will be working across departments to empower all stakeholders to make better decisions through data-oriented solutions, with a focus on making data easy and accessible at Clio. You will help our business grow, help our customers succeed, and continuously improve the way we operate.

Who you are:

We aren’t looking for just any traditional Business Intelligence Analyst to join this team. We’re looking for someone who takes data seriously, thrives in a rapid-growth, high-velocity environment, and someone who lives and breathes their values. We’re looking for an innovator and a thought leader! We’re looking for someone who is:

  • Passionate about driving growth empirically;
  • Always looking to innovate with data and explore open-ended questions;
  • Strategically minded and never shies away from a challenge;
  • Self-motivated and able to work autonomously and collaboratively;
  • Agile and responsive, and comfortable with constant change.

What you’ll work on:

  • Partnering with stakeholders, self-serve report creators, the data scientists and data engineers, and others to create meaningful, intentional data solutions;
  • Standardizing source of truth dashboards and applying best practices to create dashboards that convey the most important metrics for the business;
  • Creating and editing data models for users to answer business questions and optimize queries and reports for performance;
  • Effectively communicating findings and feedback to technical and non-technical stakeholders;
  • Working with the Business Intelligence Manager to govern our BI environment to empower our self serve stakeholders leveraging data and dashboards;
  • Working with the Business Intelligence Manager to proactively identify and resolve gaps in training, learning resources, and other roadblocks preventing stakeholders from leveraging data for decision making.

What you may have:

  • An undergraduate or graduate degree in a relevant quantitative discipline (computing science, statistics, mathematics, etc.);
  • 3+ years applied experience in business intelligence and/or data modeling;
  • Proficiency in database modeling, SQL, and knowledge of data warehousing principles;
  • Proficiency with data visualization and data storytelling;
  • An understanding or familiarity of SaaS business metrics such as MRR, churn etc;
  • A passion for understanding data and to figure out the root cause of a metric trending below target;
  • Proven experience with one or several cloud based business intelligence tools, incl. Tableau, PowerBI, and Looker;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Serious bonus points if you:

  • Have experience working with Redshift or other cloud data warehouses;
  • Are an expert translating technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders;

What you will find here:

Compensation is one of the main components of Clio’s Total Rewards Program. We have developed a series of programs and processes to ensure we are creating fair and competitive pay practices that form the foundation of our human and high-performing culture.

Some highlights of our Total Rewards program include:

  • Competitive, equitable salary with top-tier health benefits, dental, and vision insurance
  • Hybrid work environment, with expectation for local Clions (Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, and Dublin) to be in office min. once per week on our Anchor Day.
  • Flexible time off policy, with an encouraged 20 days off per year.
  • $2000 annual counseling benefit
  • RRSP matching and RESP contribution
  • Clioversary recognition program with special acknowledgement at 3, 5, 7, and 10 years

The expected salary range* for this role is $78,400 to $106,100 CAD. Please note there are a separate set of salary bands for other regions based on local currency.

  • Our salary bands are designed to reflect the range of skills and experience needed for the position and to allow room for growth at Clio. For experienced individuals, we typically hire at or around the midpoint of the band. The top portion of the salary band is reserved for employees who demonstrate sustained high performance and impact at Clio. Those who are new to the role may join below the midpoint and develop their skills over time. The final offer amount for this role will be dependent on geographical region, applicable experience, and skillset of the candidate.

Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility

Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst – BTO
Description:
JOIN US IN ENABLING TRADE THROUGH CANADA'S LARGEST PORT.

The Vancouver Fraser Port Authority is an arm’s-length federal agency responsible for the shared stewardship of the lands and waters that make up the Port of Vancouver, Canada’s largest port. Our mandate, as outlined in the Canada Marine Act, is to enable Canada’s trade objectives on behalf of all Canadians, ensuring the safe movement of goods through the Port of Vancouver while protecting the environment and considering local communities.




As an organization with a significant impact on communities and businesses across Canada, the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority is dedicated to diversity, inclusion, and sustainability. We strive to create a workplace that mirrors the richness of our community, empowering all employees to achieve their full potential.




The business intelligence analyst – BTO develops and implements visualizations and dashboards that provide actionable insights to the business. This role uses a blend of creative and technical skills to develop intuitive BI solutions that meet the needs of our users.




What You Do:

Collaborate with business units to gather requirements, objectives, and KPIs, understand their reporting, data, and product needs, and identify data dependencies and relationships
Create appropriate datasets, data flows in Microsoft data platform based on the defined information architecture
Design and develop and deploy user-friendly, visually appealing BI dashboards and reports using BI tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Build and narrate data stories and guide in building PowerPoint decks
Provide technical expertise regarding the unique features and constraints of Power BI and related technologies, including best practice recommendations
Develop documentation, user guides, and training materials to support user adoption and customer service. Provide ongoing support, troubleshooting, and maintenance of workflows, addressing user-reported issues
Catalogue, develop and maintain operational reporting, dashboards and scorecards that track organization key metrics




What You Bring:

Bachelor’s degree in data science, computer science, management information systems, or other relevant discipline
Minimum three (3) years of experience working with BI tools or any data-specific role, plus demonstrated experience of database management, data modeling, business intelligence, SQL querying, data warehousing, and online analytical processing (OLAP)
Expertise in tools and systems on MS SQL Server BI Stack, including SSRS and TSQL, Power Query, MDX, Power BI, and DAX is required
Experience in configuration of Microsoft Dynamics and Power Platforms is an asset
Experience in configuring, customizing, and extending Dynamics 365 CRM to meet business needs, including workflows, forms, entities, and plugins is an asset
Strong ability to discern trends and patterns from large amounts of raw data
Excellent analytic and problem-solving skills with the ability to take a thoughtful data driven approach to addressing workforce challenges
Must be able to deal with ambiguity and create processes and structure where it does not currently exist
Ability to maintain utmost confidentiality and work with restricted confidential data
Ability to quickly shape data in reporting and analytics solutions and perform testing to assure report and dashboard accuracy




What We Offer:

Market-competitive base salaries and variable incentive plan
Generous and inclusive benefits offering including retirement benefits plan
Earned time off program
Paid vacation and personal care leave
Learning, development, and advancement opportunities
Onsite gym with towel service in a national landmark in the heart of Vancouver’s waterfront
Friendly, unique, and respectful workplace




Location: Vancouver, Canada

Job type: Bargaining Unit, Full-Time, Permanent, Hybrid

Working environment: Normal office conditions. Flexibility to respond to issues during non-working hours as required.




Marine Transportation Security Clearance

This position is required to access restricted areas/information. The incumbent must obtain and maintain a valid Marine Transportation Security Clearance as defined by the Marine Transportation Security Regulations.




This is Canadian-based employment, and it is expected that all employees maintain legal entitlement to work in Canada. Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be subject to background checks, including but not limited to criminal record, credit, and/or reference checks.




At the Vancouver Fraser Port Authority, we are dedicated to employment equity and a workplace reflective of the diversity of our port community. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates including women, persons with disabilities, Indigenous peoples, and members of visible minorities. Reasonable accommodation can be provided in the selection process and while working with the port authority. If you require support applying to our openings, please contact us at careers@portvancouver.com.




We recognize and acknowledge that we are located on the traditional territories of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and səlilwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations. To learn more about our indigenous relations and commitment to reconciliation, please visit our website.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Specialist
Description:
Working at Trail Appliances means joining an entrepreneurial-minded, driven team dedicated to delivering an exceptional customer experience. Trail Appliances is the leading independent appliance retailer in Western Canada. We’re a fast-growing company with over 500 employees in British Columbia, spread out over 10 showrooms, 3 Outlet Centres, 3 distribution centres, and 4 offices in BC's major markets. Join our team of trailblazers! Our core values: Integrity – We do what’s right, even when no one is looking. Improvement – We do it well. Then we do it better. Caring – We put ourselves in others’ shoes. Authenticity – We like people, not pretense. Determination – We kick down walls. We have everything we need to inspire our customers. Except you. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Software Development, the Data Engineer will be instrumental in designing, managing and supporting operationally the data and reporting landscape for the business. The position will be a very strategic role leveraging the candidate’s experience in data modelling, data warehousing and report model creation to help shape the next generation of business intelligence and report offerings for the business as we move towards a new to be architecture leveraging the latest technologies in the space. The position will be joining at an exciting time as the business has embarked on a digital transformation journey moving its operation to the cloud and new technologies. As a BI Data Specialist, you will


Have ownership and governance of the business intelligence and reporting platform offerings for the business
Provide insight into reporting platform usage and metrics
Support migration of the existing data warehouse and related critical reporting to a new future state data warehousing platform and data structure
Enforce data cleanliness and consistency and be the gatekeeper for data quality in the bi platform.
Create data dictionaries to support the reporting platform
Identify opportunities that can improve efficiency of business processes
Troubleshoot technical issues and identify modifications needed in existing reporting applications to meet changing user requirements



To be successful in this role, you have


Minimum of 8 years’ practical experience
Post-secondary degree in computer science or related field or a combination of related experience and education.
Strong general technical experience with relational databases, data modelling and data warehousing principles
Expertise in the Microsoft SQL Server stack – TSQL, SSIS, SSRS and SSAS
Expertise in Microsoft Power BI
Strong working experience with data migration, data cleansing, validation and de-duplication
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Experience in the development and implementation of standards, procedures and guidelines to support operational processes.
Self-motivation and the ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, and manage changing priorities
Proven ability to be flexible and work hard, both independently and in a team environment
Willingness to work occasionally outside of normal business hours.
Willingness to learn
Excellent English oral and written communication skills.
A results-oriented individual who thrives working in a fast-paced environment



The experience we like to see


Practical experience with cloud computing (Azure preferred)
Practical experience with Microsoft D365
Practical experience with Azure DevOps
Working knowledge of CI/CD and associated pipelines
Working knowledge of GIT
Practical experience with Azure Data Warehouse
Practical experience with Microsoft Fabric including Synapse Data Warehouse and Data Factory
Practical experience with CRM



Why Join Trail?


Extended Health Benefits
Merit Performance
Generous employee discounts
Gym membership discount
Professional Development Programs
Employee Recognition Program
Company events
Paid Volunteer



INDHPN We inspire possibilities, make shopping ridiculously easy, and help create special moments at home. Are you ready to meet your team?

Title: Data & Analytics - Analytics Engineer
Description:
THE TEAM

The mission of the Analytics Department is to provide the business with actionable and accurate information to enable data-driven decision-making.




THE OPPORTUNITY

Aritzia is experiencing exponential growth, and the Data & Analytics team is growing with it. This is a unique opportunity to join the Analytics Engineering Department, where you will transform raw data in a modern platform and create models that empower self-serve analysis, reporting, and data science. As the Analytics Engineer, you will support and enable the business, apply data modeling expertise, and become the data domain go-to person. And with the skills you gain in this role the opportunities are endless, from a rewarding career in Data & Analytics to continued growth at Aritzia.




THE ROLE

As the Analytics Engineer, you will lead and be involved in:

Develop complex SQL transformations to create beautifully designed and widely used data models
Embed and enrich business logic to unify the analysis of cross functional teams
Design and recommend data model structure and flow
Review and approve model changes and be the technical owner for specific data sub-domains
Create in Google Cloud Platform and Dataform (Google’s version of DBT)
Contribute to and leverage the best practices and standards of analytics engineering




THE QUALIFICATIONS

The Analytics Engineer has:

Proven skills, education, and/or applicable certifications in:
Excellent SQL skills with the ability to create efficient data models, applied to cloud data warehousing in particular
Strong business modelling skills: going from expressed requirements to an actual data model
Varied design options of reshaping data tables
Modern cloud data platforms such as GCP, MS, AWS
Object-oriented programming (OOP) understanding
SAP HANA data environment is a plus
An enthusiastic approach to taking on new opportunities and challenges
The ability to collaborate fluently with cross-functional partners
A commitment to learn and apply Aritzia's Business and People Leadership principles




THE COMPENSATION

The typical hiring range for this position is $75,000 - $150,000 CAD per year. The final agreed upon salary may vary based on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills and experience.




We are always looking for top talent - if your qualifications differ from those listed above, the scope of work and final agreed upon [salary/wage] may be adjusted to reflect your individual qualifications.




Aritzia’s Everyday Luxury compensation package goes beyond the base salary with endless growth and recognition opportunities through our pay-for-performance philosophy. Along with comprehensive benefits, aspirational workspaces and elevated employee perks and experiences - we provide it all.




THE PERKS

Some of the industry-leading benefits you will receive working at Aritzia:

Flexible Working Model - The option to work Remotely, On-site, or Hybrid in Canada
A-OK Commissary & Café - Our in-office, world-class bistro and café
The SET - Our in-house gym, with state-of-the art equipment and custom classes
Dog Friendly Office - Bring your best friend to work
Product Discount - Our famous product discount, online and in store




ARITZIA




Aritzia is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Our goal is to be inclusive, diverse, and representative of the communities where we work while creating an environment where every person can enjoy a successful career. This commitment applies to all candidates and employees regardless of race, ethnicity, citizenship, creed, place of origin, religion, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, family status, marital status, disability, age, and any other protected characteristic.




Requests for accommodation due to a disability or any other protected characteristic can be made at any stage of the recruitment process and during employment by contacting our People & Culture Team.

Title: Advanced Data Analyst - Frostbite
Description:
Frostbite is EA's state-of-the-art multi-platform game development engine. Our global team empowers game creators to shape the future of gaming by developing creative engine features and outstanding tools. We are honoured to have thousands of game developers all over the world using Frostbite to create some of the most amazing games and player experiences in the industry.

The Frostbite team is working on a wide array of projects to support the needs of our game developers. As an Advanced Data Analyst, reporting to the Director of Analytics, you will work with the Frostbite Operations team to improve the efficiency of our business operations. You will use your analytical skills to transform the operational needs of the business into insights and influence how Frostbite helps EA make amazing games.

You will..


You will work with the Sr. Operations Manager of the Frostbite team to tell a story with high-dimensionality data from multiple sources by using different tools and data analysis techniques.
You will perform data-gap analysis on the data generated by the business processes to identify improvements in the existing data and define new data to be captured.
You will design data models that capture all the essential data generated by the business processes.
You will determine important metrics that provide feedback on the efficacy of the business.
You will prepare detailed reports that help the business monitor the processes and identify new areas of opportunity to improve the impact of their products and services.
You will evaluate, interpret, and present data to find risks and opportunities to improve our service.
You will conduct statistical analysis for identifying patterns and trends, hypothesis testing, prediction, or inference.


You bring...


7+ years of work experience in a past analytical role, 3+ years of verifiable work experience in the field of business operations, using data to create operational improvements.
Bachelor's degree in a technical field (Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or Economics) or completion of post- secondary level Math and Statistics courses.
Experience of Microsoft Power BI or other comparable BI tool.
Proficient in SQL and Python.
Hands-on experience with Databricks technology and Cloud Computing platforms (i.e. Azure, AWS, or GCP).


Soft Skills


Be able to engage with both senior business management and technical people when discussing data analysis needs or findings.
Can move beyond data by translating customer needs into user requirements.


Bc Compensation And Benefits

The base salary ranges listed below are for the defined geographic market pay zones in these locations. If you reside outside of these locations, a recruiter will advise on the base salary range and benefits for your specific location.

EA has listed the base salary ranges it in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in the locations listed, as of the time of this posting. Salary offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, and business or organizational needs.

BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria):


º $107,600 - $147,100 CAN Annually

Base salary is just one part of the overall compensation at EA. We also offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.
Show more

We are honoured to have thousands of game developers all over the world using Frostbite to create some of the most amazing games and player experiences in the industry.

The Frostbite team is working on a wide array of projects to support the needs of our game developers. As an Advanced Data Analyst, reporting to the Director of Analytics, you will work with the Frostbite Operations team to improve the efficiency of our business operations. You will use your analytical skills to transform the operational needs of the business into insights and influence how Frostbite helps EA make amazing games.

You will..

  • You will work with the Sr. Operations Manager of the Frostbite team to tell a story with high-dimensionality data from multiple sources by using different tools and data analysis techniques.
  • You will perform data-gap analysis on the data generated by the business processes to identify improvements in the existing data and define new data to be captured.
  • You will design data models that capture all the essential data generated by the business processes.
  • You will determine important metrics that provide feedback on the efficacy of the business.
  • You will prepare detailed reports that help the business monitor the processes and identify new areas of opportunity to improve the impact of their products and services.
  • You will evaluate, interpret, and present data to find risks and opportunities to improve our service.
  • You will conduct statistical analysis for identifying patterns and trends, hypothesis testing, prediction, or inference.

You bring...

  • 7+ years of work experience in a past analytical role, 3+ years of verifiable work experience in the field of business operations, using data to create operational improvements.
  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field (Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Mathematics, or Economics) or completion of post- secondary level Math and Statistics courses.
  • Experience of Microsoft Power BI or other comparable BI tool.
  • Proficient in SQL and Python.
  • Hands-on experience with Databricks technology and Cloud Computing platforms (i.e. Azure, AWS, or GCP).

Soft Skills

  • Be able to engage with both senior business management and technical people when discussing data analysis needs or findings.
  • Can move beyond data by translating customer needs into user requirements.

Bc Compensation And Benefits

The base salary ranges listed below are for the defined geographic market pay zones in these locations. If you reside outside of these locations, a recruiter will advise on the base salary range and benefits for your specific location.

EA has listed the base salary ranges it in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in the locations listed, as of the time of this posting. Salary offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, and business or organizational needs.

BASE SALARY RANGES

  • British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria):

º $107,600 - $147,100 CAN Annually

Base salary is just one part of the overall compensation at EA. We also offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
At our core, Electronic Arts is a game maker that connects hundreds of millions of players from around the globe to some of the world's greatest games. The EAX team is driving the strategy and implementation of essential projects for EA's community of players to connect them to the games they love to play. These projects span the digital touchpoints where players use the EA Network, including EA's gaming service on PC through the new EA Desktop application; the EA Play subscription program on PC, PlayStation, Xbox, and Steam; EA.com's corporate, marketing and player engagement activations, and a host of other consumer experiences and strategies to connect players across platforms and within our games.

As a Data Architect, you will be instrumental in moulding EAX’s data solutions, including structure, validation, documentation, storage, and retrieval. Partnering with product owners, designers, DDs, QV, and other engineers, you will design unified data models that support the current needs of our games and are extendable to future needs. In this role, you will strongly impact EAX’s core business, influencing how data is structured, stored, retrieved and applied. As part of the broader software engineering discipline, you report to a Lead Software Engineer on the EAX team.

Joining EAX means you will shape EA’s online presence; evolve subscription services that span three significant platforms; build consumer experiences that power EA's games and promote more personalized, socially connected experiences; and expand our platforms across web, PC, mobile, the cloud and beyond so our players can get into the games they want to play and stay connected while playing. We like to say that "we see farther," and are committed to driving innovation to meet player needs today and in the future.

You're Someone With a Proven Track Record Who


Has experience working with distributed systems and large-scale data infrastructure
Is excited about improving the player experience by simplifying large, complex data sets that power player-facing apps
Seeks opportunities to improve the employee experience for engineers and content authors
Has designed or supported data schemas and data validation workflows
Is experienced in developing and maintaining data management systems and workflows
Has experience writing comparison scripts and tools


You also bring the following skills or experiences to our team:


Experience with high-scale e-commerce
Experience in data migration from legacy systems
An interest in gaming or digital platforms and digital distribution strategies
Skilled in gathering and analyzing system requirements, identifying gaps, and proposing practical solutions while ensuring alignment with business goals
Experienced in managing, querying, and analyzing structured and unstructured databases
Strong understanding of various database types (relational, graph, document) and APIs


In a typical week, the Data Architect may...


Collaborate with engineering and publishing teams to understand and improve workflows
Contribute to normalizing data models, systems and apps to meet reliability, performance and compliance needs
Review and provide feedback on data modeling opportunities supporting a new ecommerce feature
Collaborate with external teams to continuously update and align a data strategy


You’ll build relationships and work with…


Other members of the EAX organization to provide engineering support and feedback
EA staff who publish content and games to EA apps
Game development teams for support, feature requests and distribution platform feature integration


"

Bc Compensation And Benefits

The base salary ranges listed below are for the defined geographic market pay zones in these locations. If you reside outside of these locations, a recruiter will advise on the base salary range and benefits for your specific location.

EA has listed the base salary ranges it in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in the locations listed, as of the time of this posting. Salary offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, and business or organizational needs.

BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria):


º $115,100 - $161,200 CAN Annually

Base salary is just one part of the overall compensation at EA. We also offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity. "

Title: Content Insights Analyst
Description:
About us

BitKernel is dedicated to innovation and creating new firms in the OTT industry. With a solid technological foundation, we specialize in Strategic Marketing Consulting, Big Data, and disruptive technologies such as Web 3.0. This role will serve as the function of one of our companies under the umbrella.




What Will Your Next Role Look Like?

As a Content Insight Analyst [Anime/K-Drama/Film], you will help with the continuous growth of the platform! We are looking for someone with a solid understanding and knowledge of the film industry, especially an avid consumer of anime and cultural trends in the Japanese community. In other words, an Anime Lover who is capable of expressing through the language of film and has a skillful writing ability.




Responsibilities

Tracking and studying popular and classic anime worldwide. Delve into and analyze globally popular and classic anime works, observing their popularity and influence in different markets.
Planning and improving database animation category field information. Enhance the database by improving the categorization and information fields for anime works, celebrities, lists, and reviews.
Reorganizing anime classification. Use multidimensional tags and lists to reorganize and categorize anime works, enhancing user experience and streamlining content retrieval.
Monitor core data regularly. Deeply analyzing data trends and user behaviour. Provide data reports on content operations and suggest efficient content distribution and management strategies based on analysis.
Output multi-dimensional viewing guidance and content recommendation strategies effectively.
Investigating overseas content and user preferences to provide suggestions for copyright procurement of content.




Qualifications

BA/BS degree or higher; majors in Theater & Film, Writing, Marketing, English, or related fields are preferred.
3+ years of working experience in the movie and TV industry or entertainment & media industry, with familiarity with content operations processes.
Proficient in English communication (speaking and writing). Fluency in English, Spanish, or Portuguese as a workplace language and excellent media writing skills in English, Spanish, or Portuguese (Japanese is a plus).
Extensive experience and knowledge of media (anime) industry trends, familiar with internet media services such as IMDb, Letterboxd, Rotten Tomatoes, Netflix, Amazon Prime, Crunchyroll, etc.
Rich viewing history of anime, with trackable records of marking 100+ entries on IMDb or Letterboxd, or equivalent.
Ability to present ideas openly and collaborate with team members from diverse backgrounds.




Perks & Benefits

Extended Health and Dental Benefits. Ensuring your well-being is always a priority for us.
Growth and Development Opportunities. A way to take your career to the next level with us! We will work through our Learning and Development Program to help you achieve your professional goal.
Engaging Team Building Activities. We believe in solid connections. Therefore, we have fostered a variety of events and internal clubs to help you become part of our culture.
Comfortable and Fun Office Environment. A well-equipped office with ergonomic furniture, snacks, and beverages to keep you energized throughout the day.
Friday Happy Hour. The perfect way to end the week on a high note with the team!




Your Next Big Opportunity Awaits!

In BitKernel, we appreciate every candidate and their time. Therefore, our Talent team will review each application and will get back to those who successfully match our needs. As a note, this position is based in Vancouver, BC, so we are only considering those based locally and eligible to work in Canada. We invite every qualified candidate to apply! If you don't have the qualifications needed but have the potential and education, we will leave a space for you to explain "Why" you could be the next Content Insight Analyst. We will try to reach out and see if there is a place for you here now or maybe in the future.




We are recognized as an equal-opportunity company and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. Every qualified applicant will be considered for this position, regardless of their race, nationality, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Let's make this environment a place where everyone is recognized, feels valued, and is open to the full field of what they do best!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Must have skills:

Develop big data processing systems using Apache Spark, Airflow, Databricks, AWS and related technologies
ETL and API's
Understand Continuous Integration (CI) and Delivery (CD) concepts, and capabilities to support automation, pipelines, virtualization, and containerization
Fluency in one or more languages like Scala, Java, Python etc.




Desired skills:

Knowledge of Microservices and scaling techniques
Experience using web service APIs




ETL pipeline to ingest data to a database which is fundamental to APIs (and hence the companies) to prevent fraudulent transactions and streamline account creation. The tech stack used by the team is enticing as we use Apace Spark, AWS and Databricks. The team has a healthy work culture where the team members support each other and work collaboratively.

Show more
HTML:
Must have skills:

  1. Develop big data processing systems using Apache Spark, Airflow, Databricks, AWS and related technologies
  2. ETL and API's
  3. Understand Continuous Integration (CI) and Delivery (CD) concepts, and capabilities to support automation, pipelines, virtualization, and containerization
  4. Fluency in one or more languages like Scala, Java, Python etc.


Desired skills:

  1. Knowledge of Microservices and scaling techniques
  2. Experience using web service APIs


ETL pipeline to ingest data to a database which is fundamental to APIs (and hence the companies) to prevent fraudulent transactions and streamline account creation. The tech stack used by the team is enticing as we use Apace Spark, AWS and Databricks. The team has a healthy work culture where the team members support each other and work collaboratively.

Title: Business Systems Analyst (ERP systems)
Description:
Who we are:

We are a bunch of people who really care about agriculture, food and the challenges facing farming. We want to help farmers with data driven decision making to help nature feed a growing population. Join our team of expert engineers, agronomists, entomologists, crop researchers, and data scientists who are continually conducting research to help drive innovation in agriculture.

Semios is a market leader in leveraging the internet-of-things (IoT) and big data to improve the sustainability and profitability of specialty crops. With 500 million data points being reported by our sensors every day, we leverage our big data analytics, such as in-depth pest and disease modeling, to empower tree fruit and tree nut growers with decision-making tools to minimize resources and risks.

Our innovative work has received several industry awards:


AgTech Breakthrough Awards Program (2023) - Selected as winner of the "Overall Smart Irrigation Company Of The Year" award.
Sustainability Changemaker by SDTC (2022) - Named as one of the companies which recognize homegrown innovation in sustainable technologies in Canada
AgTech Breakthrough Awards Program (2021) - Selected as winner of the "Pest Management Solutions of the Year" award
Google Accelerator (2020) - Selected as 1 of 9 companies for the inaugural Google for Startups Accelerator Canada cohort, who are all using technology to solve complex challenges
Global CleanTech Top 100 (2020) - Identified as one of the companies best positioned to solve tomorrow's clean technology challenges


One of our partners produced this short video which shows what we do and our positive environmental impact.

We know our journey is only achievable by having a great team who shares ideas, tries new things and learns as we go.

Who you are:

Motivated by meaningful work, you are looking for more than just a job; you want to work for a dynamic, growing company that finds solutions to real-life problems, such as helping the world reduce the use of pesticides and helping nature feed a growing population. Your ideal work environment includes a collaborative team spirit with the opportunity to learn and grow as you take the initiative to try new things.

As a Business Systems Analyst you'll liaise with cross functional teams to deliver processes and systems improvements, leveraging your strong analytical, stakeholder engagement and problem-solving skills. The Business Systems Analyst must have expertise in defining business processes, business systems analysis, and implementation and support of modern ERP systems. You will play an important role in elevating our business operations and enable us to achieve operational excellence.

What you will do:


Analyze business processes and systems, pinpoint inefficiencies and opportunities, and implement improvements to enhance operational efficiency
Part of the core team to lead the implementation and configuration of business systems, optimize business processes and respond to user report-writing and analysis requests
Take ownership of gathering and delivering comprehensive business requirements, process flows and user stories to stakeholders, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and completeness. ensuring comprehensive understanding of the proposed solutions meeting business needs
Contribute to enablement strategy development with a strong understanding of business needs and impacts to influence roadmaps
Apply previous experience and knowledge of business systems and processes, and evolving technologies like Generative AI to provide insights for optimizing business processes in inventory management, field services planning, sales operations
Actively participate in driving adoption of processes and systems changes through user testing, addressing usage issues, building and delivering training content and monitoring user feedback
Document, track, and monitor all problems/resolutions activity to ensure timely resolution and adherence to department guidelines.
Keep stakeholders informed of significant or recurring issues that have an effect on business operations
Manage external support requirements with third-party providers
Develop and maintain user instructions and support documentation for enterprise business systems tailored for technical and non-technical users.
Measure the success of new features with external and internal users and develop plans to continuously improve on product usage
Monitor and evaluate process performance through data trend analysis for further improvements, generating insights and recommendations
Prepare and present data-driven insights to informed decision-making



Requirements

We want you to succeed so you will need:


5+ years of experience in a business systems analyst role
Bachelor's degree in computer science, business administration (operations, logistics, supply chain), engineering or a related field
Experience in a lead role for an ERP implementation that included Finance, Supply Chain and Inventory Management, and demonstrated knowledge of internal operational processes in these areas
Experience with ERP system configuration, master data management, workflow development, and report writing
Technical document writing, including business process mapping, work instructions, and standard operating procedures
Understanding of data mapping and ETL process, and experience building data driven insights, using reporting tools such as Power BI and Tableau
Ability to plan and manage tasks and adhere to project timelines and milestones
Experience with identifying creative and efficient solutions to complex problems with strong analytical and reasoning skills, and adept at handling ambiguity with attention to detail
Solid aptitude for evolving technologies like Generative AI and its role in business enablement
Strong skills in IT software tools such as Jira, Visio, Mural, Lucidchart, Google suite
Strong ability to independently manage time and prioritize tasks
Strong facilitation and stakeholder management skill, earn trust quickly and convey ideas succinctly and with influence both verbal and visually



Nice to have:


Formal training or certification in enterprise software or reporting tools, including MS D365, PowerBI, Tableau, CRM (Salesforce, Hubspot, D365)
Formal training or certification in business analysis techniques such as Certified Business Analysis Professional or Certified Lean Six Sigma professional are a plus
Experience working with companies with international operations
Knowledge of AI application in enterprise systems
System implementation experience
Agile project management experience



Salary range: $100,000 to $115,000 annually

Please note that the base pay offered may vary based on factors including but not limited to knowledge, skills and experience, as well as business and organizational needs.

Benefits

Why this is the opportunity for you:


Sleep better knowing you're making the world a better place through more sustainable food production
Opportunity to contribute and make an impact by working on meaningful projects
Work with a team that values fun, laughter, and each other in a collaborative and casual work environment
Flexible, hybrid working arrangements and strong work-life balance culture
Multiple office locations, convenient via transit and bike paths
Extended medical plan with a Health Spending Account with premiums paid by the company
Group RRSP, which includes a 3% company paid match


At Semios, we recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. We know that our differences often can bring about innovation, excellence and meaningful work—therefore, people from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply to our positions. We believe that different perspectives and backgrounds are what make a company flourish and we welcome everyone.
Show more

  • Sleep better knowing you're making the world a better place through more sustainable food production
  • Opportunity to contribute and make an impact by working on meaningful projects
  • Work with a team that values fun, laughter, and each other in a collaborative and casual work environment
  • Flexible, hybrid working arrangements and strong work-life balance culture
  • Multiple office locations, convenient via transit and bike paths
  • Extended medical plan with a Health Spending Account with premiums paid by the company
  • Group RRSP, which includes a 3% company paid match

At Semios, we recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. We know that our differences often can bring about innovation, excellence and meaningful work—therefore, people from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply to our positions. We believe that different perspectives and backgrounds are what make a company flourish and we welcome everyone.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
This is a primarily remote role in Vancouver. Candidates must be in British Columbia or Winnipeg to be considered for this role.







In this role, you will join a stable and tenured team, and a large company in the retail industry. You will be a generalist; you will mainly design and develop ETL processes, and part of your work will be data analysis.







This company is in the process of migrating to the cloud, and integrating a large variety of data sources and internal applications. They are in the early stages of their data integration work, and you will help with the planning and architecture. You will help with platform selection as well.







If you have experience with large-scale data integration projects and migrations to the cloud, we encourage you to apply!




What you will do and how you will make an impact …







You will work with a team of Programmer Analysts, Business Analysts, Solutions Architects and QAs.




You will work with a mix of sales, inventory and internal operations data.







You will work with a variety of data sources, and will work collaboratively with the team to plan the data integration.







You will design and develop ETL processes.







You will work with SQL databases and will use Power BI for reporting.







Qualifications

Minimum 3 years of experience in a Data Engineer / ETL Developer role







Previous experience with relational databases







Previous experience supporting a large data integration project / supporting an organization’s migration to the cloud







Does this sound like it was written for you? Excellent! Please apply and let’s explore this together.







The interview process …







A bit about myself - my name is Tanvi Krishna, and I am a recruitment consultant based in Vancouver, BC. I am constantly working on IT and creative roles, and I am always looking to meet new people.







If you're interested in pursuing this role, please apply to this posting. If you are selected for the next stage, I will contact you for an initial discussion. This will be a chance for us to discuss the job requirements in greater detail, as well as your career goals and preferences for your next position. We can also discuss other opportunities which may fit what you're looking for.







Please feel free to reach out and find me on LinkedIn by searching my name: Tanvi Krishna







Compensation & benefits …







This is a full-time and permanent position that includes a competitive base salary, extended health and dental benefits, and paid vacation.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
EA SPORTS is one of the most iconic brands in entertainment – connecting hundreds of millions around the world to the sports they love through a portfolio of industry-leading video games.

At the heart of EA SPORTS is the FC franchise. EA SPORTS FC is the world's #1 best-selling video game with over 200M engaged players across multiple platforms, including console, PC, and mobile. Innovation, passion, and teamwork are at the heart of everything we do. With studios in Vancouver, Bucharest, and Cologne, we're looking for the brightest talent, so we can continue to create experiences that connect with millions of hearts and minds the world over.

Reporting to the Data Science Manager, we are looking for a Data Engineer passionate about building high impact end to end data pipelines driving actionable insights. We are a small team of multidisciplinary data professionals. The ideal candidate is comfortable working in a dynamic environment where they can wear multiple hats to achieve the business goals while delivering quality work. Daily responsibilities include but are not limited to working directly with stakeholders to collect requirements, write design documents, implement ETLs and data quality checks.

Your Responsibilities


Work with raw data, design schemas, optimize data transformation, and manage deployments and maintenance of data pipelines
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Develop real-time ingestion, processing, and alerting data pipelines
Evaluate feasibility and effectiveness of proposed data solutions
End-to-end administration and maintain tools, systems, pipelines and ETLs
Communicate designs, issues, and trade-offs to stakeholders


Your Qualifications


Ability to think and solve complex data engineering problems in maintainable and scalable fashion
Hands-on experience with SQL and no-SQL databases
1+ years of experience with Big Data technologies such as Trino, Spark, Databricks, Kafka
1+ years of experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools such as Airflow
1+ years of experience using business intelligence reporting tools such as Tableau or Looker
1+ years of experience working with Cloud technologies (preferably AWS)
Knowledge and experience with several programming languages such as Python, C#, Scala
Familiarity with machine learning, and statistical approaches to data analysis


Bc Compensation And Benefits

The base salary ranges listed below are for the defined geographic market pay zones in these locations. If you reside outside of these locations, a recruiter will advise on the base salary range and benefits for your specific location.

EA has listed the base salary ranges it in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in the locations listed, as of the time of this posting. Salary offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, and business or organizational needs.

BASE SALARY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria): º $79,900 - $111,900 CAN Annually


Base salary is just one part of the overall compensation at EA. We also offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.
